rado: <entryFree id="n40353" type="main" key="ra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scrape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scratch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rub</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">smooth;</hi> of the hair, <hi rend="ital">to shave off with a razor</hi> (while tondere is to cut off with shears; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. scabo). </sense><sense id="n40353.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: MVLIERES GENAS NE RADVNTO, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lacerate by scratching</hi>, in mourning, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 58, § 157</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Fest. s. v. radere, p. 227: fauces,</quote> <trans><tr>to irritate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 528</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 13</bibl> Spald.; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 3, 20: terram pedibus (corvus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput et supercilia,</quote> <trans><tr>to shave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit> (just before, abrasa); <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput, as a token of slavery,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in mourning,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in execution of a vow made in times of peril,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 81</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103</bibl> sqq.): <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the person himself: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tonderetur diligenter ac raderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 59, 59, § 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna,</quote> <trans><tr>to smooth off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 358</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <trans><tr>to sweep the mosaic ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <trans><tr>to scratch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 13, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aream,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to clear of bushes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medicam marris ad solum,</quote> <trans><tr>to weed out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva imbribus (Eurus),</quote> <trans><tr>to strip</tr>, <tr>lay waste</tr>, <tr>sweep</tr>, <tr>ravage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:54" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terras (Aquilo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen fastis,</quote> <trans><tr>to scratch out</tr>, <tr>erase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margine in extremo littera rasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae rasae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 437</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40353.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n40353.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch in passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brush along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graze;</hi> of streams: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas radentia flumina rodunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:242" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 16</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of sailors: hinc altas cautes projectaque saxa Pachyni Radimus (in sailing by),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 700</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:108" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:246 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 246 al.</bibl>: sicco freta radere passu (with percurrere; <cit><quote lang="la">of horses running past),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra rasa squamis (serpentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva radens serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:525" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 525</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 217</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trajectos surculus rasit,</quote> <trans><tr>crept through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40353.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nip off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnosa canicula quantum raderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>: ista tonstrix radit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shaves</hi> her customers (sc. of their money), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:17:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40353.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grate upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures delicatas radere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras auriculas mordaci vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:107" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallentes mores,</quote> <trans><tr>to lash</tr>, <tr>satirize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
radula: <entryFree id="n40354" type="hapax" key="ra_du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rādŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rado</etym>, <sense id="n40354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scraping-iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scraper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raeda: <entryFree id="n40355" type="main" key="raeda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raeda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rēda</orth> (falsely written <orth extent="full" lang="la">rhē-da</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prob. Celtic: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima Gallica valuerunt ut raeda ac petorritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n40355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a travelling-carriage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wagon with four wheels</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">451, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raedarius: <entryFree id="n40356" type="main" key="raeda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raedārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rēdārĭus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>raeda</etym>, <sense id="n40356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a four-wheeled carriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">raedārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n40356.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A coachman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the driver of a ræda</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raedarium occidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40356.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wagon-builder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coachmaker</hi>, Capitol. Max. et Balb. 5, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
raeti: <entryFree id="n40357" type="main" key="Raeti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Raeti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhaeti</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Rætians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mountain people north of the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Danube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the Lech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 15 al.</bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n40357.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raetia</orth><pb n="1522" /> <cb n="RAMO" />  (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhaetia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Ræti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Rætia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n40357.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raetĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rhaetĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rætian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:226" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum (of excellent quality),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:100 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 100 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40357.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raetius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rætian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40357.4" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raetus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rætian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raia: <entryFree id="n40358" type="main" key="raia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:144" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 42, 67, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ralla: <entryFree id="n40359" type="main" key="Ralla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ralla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the Marcian</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n40359.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Marcius Ralla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40359.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Marcius Ralla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rallum: <entryFree id="n40360" type="main" key="rallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rado</etym>, <sense id="n40360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for scraping off the earth from the ploughshare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rallus: <entryFree id="n40361" type="hapax" key="rallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rallus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [for rarulus, from rarus], <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans><tr>a thin tunic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramale: <entryFree id="n40362" type="main" key="ra_ma_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brushwood;</hi> very rare in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ramale vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 97</bibl></cit>.— Usually <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 644</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:59" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramenta: <entryFree id="n40363" type="main" key="ra_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; less freq. in <number>sing.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmen-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 77</bibl>) [rado]. <sense id="n40363.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">what is grated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaved</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rubbed off; scrapings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shavings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chips</hi>, etc. (larger than scobes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas scobe ramentisve abietis, populi, fraxini servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <trans><tr>scales struck off by the hammer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1044</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 10, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis specularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramento e cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramenta fluminum,</quote> <trans><tr>what rivers throw up on their banks</tr>, <tr>grains of sand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphuratum,</quote> <trans><tr>a sulphur-match</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n40363.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morsels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small pieces</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">patri omne (aurum) cum ramento reddidi,</quote> <trans><tr>each and every</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ramentosus: <entryFree id="n40364" type="main" key="ra_mento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ramentum</etym>, <sense id="n40364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of little bits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of small pieces</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramentum: <entryFree id="n40365" type="main" key="ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. ramenta.</entryFree>
rameus: <entryFree id="n40366" type="hapax" key="ra_me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to boughs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branches</hi>: fragmenta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sticks</hi>, = ramalia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 303</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramex: <entryFree id="n40367" type="main" key="ra_mex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40367.0" n="I" level="1"> (In <number>plur.</number>) <hi rend="ital">The blood-vessels of the lungs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 37</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40367.1" n="II" level="1"> (<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> and <number>plur.</number>) <hi rend="ital">A rupture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hernia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varicocele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 57, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:137" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 47, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 205</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40367.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A staff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramicosus: <entryFree id="n40368" type="hapax" key="ra_mi^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ramex</etym>, <sense id="n40368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with hernia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruptured</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 47, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramises: <entryFree id="n40369" type="main" key="Ramises"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ramises</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamises</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rhamses</orth>), <sense id="n40369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramnes: <entryFree id="n40370" type="main" key="Ramnes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ramnes</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ramnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n40370.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Latin stock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tribe from whose union with the</hi> Taties (<hi rend="ital">Sabines</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Luceres (<hi rend="ital">Etruscans</hi>) <hi rend="ital">sprang the most ancient Roman State;</hi> form Ramnes, usually applied to <hi rend="ital">the tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:131" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 131</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but it is called Ramnenses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 55</bibl></cit>. —From them was named, </sense><sense id="n40370.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the three centuries of knights instituted by Romulus</hi>, usually called Ramnenses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 36</bibl>; but Ramnes in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">nobles of the olden time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 342</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramosus: <entryFree id="n40371" type="main" key="ra_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of boughs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having many branches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branchy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1096</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 237</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Silvani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:751" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 751</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lappago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 65, § 102</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40371.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">branching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 446</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Stil. 3, 291</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the clouds, <hi rend="ital">branchy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 133</bibl>.—Of the Lernæan hydra, from whose trunk young serpents grew out like branches, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 73</bibl>: <cb n="RANU" /> vitae nescius error diducit mentes ramosa in compita, <hi rend="ital">into many devious ways</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramula: <entryFree id="n40372" type="main" key="ra_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hoof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56, 31</bibl></cit> (al. ungulae); 2, 58, 4.</sense></entryFree>
ramulosus: <entryFree id="n40373" type="hapax" key="ra_mu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ramulus</etym>, <sense id="n40373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of branching veins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ramulus: <entryFree id="n40374" type="main" key="ra_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 81, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:111 al" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 88, § 111 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ramus: <entryFree id="n40375" type="main" key="ra_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for rad-mus; Sanscr. root vardh, crescere; cf.: radix, radius</etym>, <sense id="n40375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twig</hi> (cf.: surculus, termes). </sense><sense id="n40375.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (arboribus) non truncus, non rami, non folia sunt denique, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 179</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 194 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui praetereuntes ramum defringerent arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ramis arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1393" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1393</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidere falcibus ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 936</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora cingite ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:296" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 296</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens ramorum umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 489</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 808</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 650</bibl>; for <hi rend="ital">the fruit of trees</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 318</bibl>; in partic., for <hi rend="ital">frankincense twigs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 211</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40375.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things having a branching form. </sense><sense id="n40375.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A branch of a stag</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s antlers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40375.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spur of a mountain chain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 134</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40375.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A club</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO">4</bibl> (5), 9, 15.—</sense><sense id="n40375.6" n="4" level="3"> = membrum virile, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40375.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An arm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mouth of a river</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos ignobiles ramos porrigit (Nilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40375.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arm of the Greek letter</hi> <foreign lang="greek">g,</foreign> used by Pythagoras as a symbol of the two paths of life, leading to virtue and vice, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence called Samii rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:56" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40375.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a branch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos amputare miseriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo, cujus patientia et perpessio et tolerantia rami sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a branch of consanguinity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ramusculus: <entryFree id="n40376" type="main" key="ra_muscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāmuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ramus</etym>, <sense id="n40376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a twig</hi> (late Lat. for ramulus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 133, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rana: <entryFree id="n40377" type="main" key="ra_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for racna; cf.: ranco, racco, to roar, cry out; Germ. röcheln; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lakei=n;</foreign> v. Cors. Ausspr. 1, p. 636 sq.</etym>. <sense id="n40377.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A frog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 381</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 375</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 378</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 431</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 14</bibl>: pluvias metuo, ranae enim <foreign lang="greek">r(htoreu/ousin,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl>, b. — <cit><quote lang="la">In partic.,</quote> <trans><tr>the tree-frog</tr>, <tr>green frog</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 8, 29, § 92</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. rubeta.— The entrails of frogs were used for charms,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 44</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: inflat se tamquam rana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fuit rana, nunc est rex, said of one who has risen from a lowly station,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 74, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40377.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40377.2" n="1" level="3"> Rana marina, <hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the frog-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fishing frog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angler</hi>: Lophius piscatorius, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also simply rana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rana piscatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40377.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A push</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">swelling on the tongue of beasts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rancens: <entryFree id="n40378" type="main" key="rancens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rancens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n40378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rancid</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 719</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">axungia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 978</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rancesco: <entryFree id="n40379" type="main" key="rancesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rancesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow rancid</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rancide: <entryFree id="n40380" type="main" key="ranci^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rancĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rancidus.</entryFree>
rancidulus: <entryFree id="n40381" type="main" key="ranci^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rancĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [rancidus] (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n40381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rancid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">disgusting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rancidulum quiddam locutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:34:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 34, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rancidus: <entryFree id="n40382" type="main" key="ranci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rancĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ranceo, rancens</etym>, <sense id="n40382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rancid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40382.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 89</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40382.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">disgusting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 92</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid rancidius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:185" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 185</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rancĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nauseously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgustingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8:1" default="NO">18, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ranco: <entryFree id="n40383" type="main" key="ranco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ranco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. racco.</entryFree>
rancor: <entryFree id="n40384" type="main" key="rancor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rancor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ranceo, rancens</etym>. <sense id="n40384.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stinking smell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rankness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rancidity</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 10, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n40384.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an old grudge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rancor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ranula: <entryFree id="n40385" type="main" key="ra_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rānŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rana</etym>. <sense id="n40385.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little frog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tadpole</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 233, 11</bibl>. <cb n="RAPI" /> — </sense><sense id="n40385.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little swelling on the tongue of cattle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 5, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ranunculus: <entryFree id="n40386" type="main" key="ra_nuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rānuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rana</etym>. <sense id="n40386.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little frog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tadpole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porwigle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 9, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40386.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, jocosely, of the inhabitants of Ulubrae (as residing in the neighborhood of marshes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40386.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A medicinal plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> batrachion, perh. <hi rend="ital">crowfoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ranunculus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 109, § 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapa: <entryFree id="n40387" type="main" key="ra_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. rapum.</entryFree>
rapacia: <entryFree id="n40388" type="hapax" key="ra_pa_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpācĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rapum</etym>, <sense id="n40388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turnip tops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 127</bibl>; v. rapicius.</sense></entryFree>
rapacida: <entryFree id="n40389" type="hapax" key="ra^pa_ci^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpācĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rapax</etym>, <sense id="n40389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">robber</hi>, a comically formed patronymic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapacitas: <entryFree id="n40390" type="main" key="ra^pa_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greediness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapacity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis in rapacitate avarior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:72:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 72, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirae filius es rapacitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:53:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 53, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rapax: <entryFree id="n40391" type="main" key="ra^pax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grasping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy of plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapacious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40391.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. furax): vos rapaces, vos praedones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim furunculus, nunc vero etiam rapax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">fur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiā rapax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procuratorum rapacissimum quemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cinara,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eager for presents</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:25" default="NO">2, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi, luporum praeda rapacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 20</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Harpyiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">răpax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a beast of prey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 247</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40391.2" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">rapacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravenous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">falces rapaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Orcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>fangs</tr>, <tr>tusks</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chryselectrum rapacissimum ignium,</quote> <trans><tr>very ignitible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 12, § 51</bibl></cit>.—As a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of floods: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda, Cic. poët. N. D. 3, 10, 24: undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danubius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Liv. 397</bibl></cit>.— Hence, transf., an appellation of the twenty-first legion and the soldiers composing it (qs. <hi rend="ital">that sweeps every thing before it</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; 18; 22.— </sense><sense id="n40391.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare), with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seizing eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avaricious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est rapacius quam natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapacia virtutis ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri omnium utilitatum et virtutum rapacissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raphaninus: <entryFree id="n40392" type="greek" key="ra^pha^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răphănīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(afa/ninos,</foreign> <sense id="n40392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of radishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made from radishes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raphanitis: <entryFree id="n40393" type="greek" key="ra^pha^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răphănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(afani=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n40393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sword-lily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 19, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raphanos: <entryFree id="n40394" type="greek" key="ra^pha^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răphănos agrĭa</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(a/fanos a)gri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n40394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of wild - radish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 46, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raphanus: <entryFree id="n40395" type="greek" key="ra^pha^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răphănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 5</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">r(a/fanos,</foreign> <sense id="n40395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a radish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 78</bibl> sqq.; 20, 4, 12, § 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:47" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:59" default="NO">59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 15, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapicius: <entryFree id="n40396" type="main" key="ra_pi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rapum</etym>, <sense id="n40396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rapes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turnips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rape-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turnip-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <trans><tr>rape-seed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 134, 1</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpīcĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. caules), <hi rend="ital">turnip-shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young turnipplants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapide: <entryFree id="n40397" type="main" key="ra^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rapidus <sense id="n40397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rapiditas: <entryFree id="n40398" type="main" key="ra^pi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rapidus</etym>, <sense id="n40398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftness</hi> of a stream that carries all before it; <hi rend="ital">velocity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidity</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 62, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapidulus: <entryFree id="n40399" type="hapax" key="ra^pi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rapidus: <entryFree id="n40400" type="main" key="ra^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tearing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seizing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40400.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare, and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 111</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 712</bibl>, the correct read. is rabidi leones).—Of hunting-dogs: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <trans><tr>a tearing</tr>, <tr>fierce pack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 242</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 890</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi> heat: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 263</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 326</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 274</bibl>.— Of a <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi> pyre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 20</bibl>.—As epithet of the sea (qs. <hi rend="ital">devouring</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 40</bibl> (al. rabidus).—</sense><sense id="n40400.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurrying along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi> (the predom. and class. signif.; esp. freq. in the <pb n="1523" /> <cb n="RAPI" /> poets). </sense><sense id="n40400.3" n="1" level="3"> Of waters: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 64 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 44</bibl> Huschk. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:6 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 6 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus fluminum (along with celeres venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 45: <cit><quote lang="la">undae (as a mere epitheton ornans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40400.4" n="2" level="3"> Of other hurrying, rapidly moving things: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 668</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Notus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">axis (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:518" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 73</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:197" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:592" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 592</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucris rapidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 478</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 906</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Stil. 1, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>quickworking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:351" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:678" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 678</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40400.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hurried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus in consiliis,</quote> <trans><tr>over-hasty</tr>, <tr>precipitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus proelia miscet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:266" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus in urbem vectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 54</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">răpĭdē</orth>, acc. to II., <hi rend="ital">hurriedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilapsus (fluvius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter confecit (along with festinanter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo rapidius ... venit Rigodulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: quod (<foreign lang="greek">paqhtiko/n</foreign>) cum rapide fertur, sustineri nullo pacto potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 37, 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapina: <entryFree id="n40401" type="main" key="ra^pi_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rapio</etym>. <sense id="n40401.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Robbery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapine</hi> (class.; in anteAug. prose, as also in Tac., Suet., Verg., and Hor., only in <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. praeda): nihil cogitant, nisi caedes, nisi incendia, nisi rapinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia in rapinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem rapinis prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:25:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 25, 1</bibl>: spes rapinarum, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes">57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:2" default="NO">2, 83, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an furtis pereamve rapinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 157</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, esp. <hi rend="ital">the act of robbery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the business</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit of plunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per latrocinia ac rapinam tolerantes vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a rapinā hostium templa vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rapinae occasio deesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:2:9" default="NO">43, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3:7" default="NO">9, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Marc. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 72, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra patuit invita rapinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 492</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nullius rei rapinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alimenti,</quote> <trans><tr>a withdrawing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 68, 68, § 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ei rapinam fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:88:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 88, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissae signa rapinae,</quote> <trans><tr>of carrying off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 818</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40401.1" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">prey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booty</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.); abstractaeque boves abjurataeque rapinae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscator ferat aequorum rapinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 87, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78:8" default="NO">8, 78, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rapina pauperis in domo vestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 23</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapinas dissipare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n40401.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A collecting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opum suarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 611</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40402" type="main" key="ra_pi_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rapum</etym>. <sense id="n40402.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A turnip-field</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:71" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40402.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a turnip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35, 2</bibl>; Inscr. Fratr. Arv. 41, 30 (2270 ap. Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
rapinatio: <entryFree id="n40403" type="hapax" key="ra^pi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. rapina</etym>, <sense id="n40403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi>: rapinationes facere, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapinator: <entryFree id="n40404" type="main" key="ra^pi_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>, only Lucil. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 129, 29</bibl>, and 167, 20 sq.</sense></entryFree>
rapio: <entryFree id="n40405" type="main" key="ra^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpĭo</orth>, <itype>pŭi, ptum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n40405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> rapsit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf. fem.</hi> ex raptabus, Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 39</bibl> P.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">a(rp;</foreign> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/rph,</foreign> a bird of prey, <foreign lang="greek">a(rpagh/, a(rpa/zw;</foreign> Lat. rapidus, rapax, rapina, etc.; cf. Sanscr. lup-, lumpāmi, rumpo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lu=ph/</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to seize and carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hurry away</hi>, = violenter sive celeriter capio (freq. and class.; in Cæs. not at all, and in Cic. mostly in the trop. signif.; cf.: ago, fero, traho, capio, sumo). </sense><sense id="n40405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40405.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo rapitis me? quo fertis me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 845</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo me cunque rapit tempestas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumasne pudenter an rapias,</quote> <trans><tr>snatch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>, <cb n="RAPI" /> 45; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes vivos rapere soleo ex acie: ex hoc nomen mihi est (sc. Harpax),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ex lustris uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucri spe et cogitatione rapi a domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aede rapuit funale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrem ab aris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deque sinu matris ridentem . . . Learchum . . . rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:516" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 516</bibl></cit> (for which, simply sinu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 450</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">hastam, de vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repagula de posti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(frondes) altā rapit arbore ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi atque ingratis ... rapiam te domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sublimem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatum in naves rapiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 77</bibl>;
