<bibl default="NO">2, 3, 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad cornuficem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad supplicium ob facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:52:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 52, § 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tortorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres, virgines, pueros ad stuprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneram virginem ad virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapi simulatur virgo ex gremio matris, aut, si ea non est, ex proximā necessitudine, cum ad virum traditur, quod videlicet ea res feliciter Romulo cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=289" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 289</bibl></cit> Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">illum (sc. lembum) in praeceps prono rapit alveus amni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec variis obsita frondibus Sub divum rapiam,</quote> <trans><tr>drag into open day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nasonis carmina rapti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>torn from his home</tr>, <tr>borne far away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40405.3" n="B" level="2"> With the idea of swiftness predominating: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus rapit Totam aciem in Teucros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapit agmina ductor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:116" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:14" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru rapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor hinc rapimur raedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Notus rapit biremes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:276" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinas venti rapuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapit per aequora navem,</quote> <trans><tr>hurries it away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 660</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis per aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missos currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes quo te rapiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 11, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma rapiat juventus,</quote> <trans><tr>snatch up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 340</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipennem dextrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40405.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">reflex. pron.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ocius hinc te Ni rapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad caedem optimi cujusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40405.5" n="C" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40405.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry off by force; to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravish; to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take by assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry by force</hi>, etc. (very freq.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praedor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei vivendum latronum ritu, ut tantum haberet, quantum rapere potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam pilam rapiunt inter se rei publicae statum tyranm ab regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines rapi jussit ... quae raptae erant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; 2, 8, 14; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry off</tr>, <tr>abduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:70" default="NO">9, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 680</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptus a dis Ganymedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Idā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne sacrum rapiente dextrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii rapiunt incensa feruntque Pergama,</quote> <trans><tr>pillage and plunder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 374</bibl></cit> (the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">a)/gousi kai fe/rousi;</foreign> for which, in prose, ferre et agere; v. ago); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapturus moenia Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theumeson,</quote> <trans><tr>to seize by force</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:370" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to plunder</tr>, <tr>lay waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:401" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:599" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptas ad litora vertere praedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 528</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapio propalam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Spartae, rapere ubi pueri et clepere discunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">agunt, rapiunt, tenent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33, 45</bibl></cit> Mos.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">along with trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 41, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with congerere, auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:44:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 44, 9</bibl></cit>.— With the idea of rapidity predominating: castra urbesque primo impetu rapere, <hi rend="ital">to conquer rapidly</hi> (= raptim capere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 23, 5</bibl> Drak.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:34" default="NO">4, 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bithyniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Part. perf. subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40405.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rapta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the ravished one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the seduced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratus raptae raptor fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 680</bibl></cit>; id. H. <cb n="RAPI" /> 5, 97; 13, 55; 16, 339; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:607" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 607</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40405.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">raptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which is stolen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapto vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>to live by robbery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 24</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 749</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ex rapto vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 144</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rapto gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 6, 3</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">rapto potiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapto uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine rapto vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40405.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:807" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 807</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:704" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapuit non dente ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 517</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40405.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry off suddenly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prematurely</hi> by death, <hi rend="ital">to snatch away</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">improvisa leti Vis rapuit rapietque gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 5</bibl>; 4, 2, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 428</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:208" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 8</bibl>: fato erepta, v. Drak.)— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et labor et durae rapit inclementia mortis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hurries on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">RAPTA EST = obiit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4475</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40405.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), of any action or motion which resembles <hi rend="ital">seizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snatching</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammanm,</quote> <trans><tr>to catch quickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 374</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:350" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 350</bibl></cit>: nigrum colorem, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assume quickly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 289</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim monstri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:744" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 744</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and v. III.: Halesus Turno feroces Mille rapit populos,</quote> <trans><tr>leads hastily on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 725</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 178</bibl>: rapiuntque ruuntque; Litora deseruere, <hi rend="ital">take hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize in haste</hi> (the cables, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 581</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas, Auct. B. Alex. 20, 4.—Of the gliding movement of a serpent nec rapit immensos orbes per humum,</quote> <trans><tr>sweeps along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars densa ferarum Tecta rapit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>range quickly through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit> Heyne; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior et campum sonipes rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40405.12" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40405.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hurry away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur quasi torrens oratio, quamvis multa cujusquemodi rapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae res verba rapiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>carry along with them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: aspice me quanto rapiat Fortuna periclo, <hi rend="ital">carries away</hi> (the figure taken from a storm at sea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in deteriorem viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(comoediam) in pejorem partem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to put a bad construction upon</tr>, <tr>to misconstrue</tr>, <tr>misrepresent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: consilium meum in contrariam partem, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionibus vulgi rapimur in errorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis in adversum rapiat casusve deusve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliqua his ampla et honesta res objecta est, totos ad se convertit et rapit,</quote> <trans><tr>seizes upon</tr>, <tr>appropriates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda ad se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae gloriam in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">almum Quae rapit hora diem,</quote> <trans><tr>snatches away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simul tecum solatia rapta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus rapit huc, rapit illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:794" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 794</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40405.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40405.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry along</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> with passion, <hi rend="ital">to transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captivate;</hi> and with a designation of the limit, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attract strongly</hi> to any thing (usually in a bad sense): <cit><quote lang="la">impetu raptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:61" default="NO">12, 10, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae ac rapinarum cupiditas caeca te rapiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amentiā rapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorne caecus, an rapit vis acrior, An culpa?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in medias res auditorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque forma rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 44: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (sc. leonem) cruenta Per medias rapit ira caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapit omnes ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:299" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 299</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">o(rmh/,</foreign> quae hominem huc et illuc rapit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quas (res) plerique inflammati aviditate rapiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus cupidine caecus ad inceptum scelus rapiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (cupiditas) ad oppugnandam Capuam rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad divinarum rerum cognitionem curā omni studioque rapiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapi ad opes augendas generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (for ad aliquid): <cit><quote lang="la">(mundus) rapit aetherios per carmina pandere census,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40405.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To seize by violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): Hippodameam raptis nactu'st nuptiis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 398 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:55" default="NO">55</bibl>; <pb n="1524" /> <cb n="RAPT" /> 1, 8, 58; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem incertam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed rapiat sitiens Venerem,</quote> <trans><tr>but may eagerly seize upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illicitas voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem adoptionis acrius in dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facinore dominationem raptum ierit expediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40405.17" n="3" level="3"> With the idea of rapidity or haste predominating, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay hold of quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in prose only since the Aug. per.): vive, Ulixes, dum licet: Oculis postremum lumen radiatum rape: non dixit cape, non pete; haberet enim moram sperantis diutius sese victurum; <cit><quote lang="la">sed rape,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 162</bibl></cit> (from an old <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rapiamus, amici, Occasionem de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 74</bibl></cit> Loers; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:471" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to wage suddenly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten</tr>, <tr>precipitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut limis rapias, quid prima secundo Cera velit versu,</quote> <trans><tr>may hastily note</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 53 al.</bibl></cit>—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">raptae prope inter arma nuptiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 2</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">repente impetu facto transitum rapuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter rapienda momenta periculorum communium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n40405.18" n="4" level="3"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to strive for</hi> in purchasing: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplaria litterarum certatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum totā certatim urbe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rapistrum: <entryFree id="n40406" type="main" key="ra_pistrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpistrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rapum</etym>, <sense id="n40406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wildrape</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapo: <entryFree id="n40407" type="hapax" key="ra^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">răpo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber</hi> (anteclass.; v. raptor), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapso: <entryFree id="n40408" type="gloss" key="rapso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rapso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, i. q. rapto, <sense id="n40408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurry away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">RAPSATA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4859</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raptim: <entryFree id="n40409" type="main" key="raptim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>raptus, from rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by snatching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurrying away</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n40409.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapaciously</hi> (very rare): ludunt raptim pila, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semine raptim avium fame devorato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 22, § 99</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n40409.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suddenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurriedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec scripsi raptim, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui donet inpermissa raptim Gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sequi, Liv 26, 5: omnia raptim atque turbate aguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">raptim omnia praepropere agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitata raptim consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium inire raptim et avide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis raptim factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa levem fugiens raptim secat aethera pennis,</quote> <trans><tr>swiftly flying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruaris tempore raptim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 198</bibl></cit> et saep. (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">raptē</orth>, Ven. Fort. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:651" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 651</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
raptio: <entryFree id="n40410" type="main" key="rapti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rape</hi> (ante- and postclass.): in raptione affuisse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proserpinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 183</bibl></cit>: Helenae, Aus. Per. Iliad. prooem. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
raptito: <entryFree id="n40411" type="gloss" key="rapti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n40411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
rapto: <entryFree id="n40412" type="main" key="rapto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rapto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n40412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> paragog. raptarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:192" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 192</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to seize and carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hurry away</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n40412.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40412.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: vidi Hectorem curru quadrijugo raptarier, <hi rend="ital">dragged along</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 105</bibl> (Trag. v. 129 Vahl.): imitated by Verg.: Hector raptatus bigis, A. 2, 272; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Hectoracirca muros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 483</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera viri Per silvas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaëthonta rapax vis solis equorum Aethere raptavit toto terrasque per omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 398</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: arbitrio volucrum raptatur equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 234</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptatur comis per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 223</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">signa, quae turbine atque unda raptabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: pars de divulso raptabant membra juvenco, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me raptas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipati liberi, raptata conjux (sc. ad tabulam Valeriam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 145</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in fluctu carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:409" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 409</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40412.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to lead quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ad ostia Ponti Raptat iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:576" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:31" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agmina turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:406" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 406</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:404" default="NO">3, 404</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexilla huc vel illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: legiones huc atque illuc, Auct. B. Afr. 73, 4. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptantur amantes jungere Nymphas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40412.4" n="C" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur raptare inter se, immittere latronum globos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:115" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 115</bibl></cit>: adhuc raptabat Africam Tacfarinas, <cb n="RARE" /> i. e. devastabat, <hi rend="ital">was laying waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 23</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40412.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40412.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to drag along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quid ego heroas, quid raptem in crimina divos?</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse</tr>, <tr>arraign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 27: <cit><quote lang="la">patres raptabat ad aras cura deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:74" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 74</bibl></cit> (cf. rapio, I. A.).—</sense><sense id="n40412.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to hurry along</hi> with passion, <hi rend="ital">to agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me amor lassum animi ludificat, fugat, agit, appetit, Raptat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer effera raptat Corda pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:799" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor raptabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:720" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 720</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raptor: <entryFree id="n40413" type="main" key="raptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who seizes by force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abductor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravisher</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: praedo, direptor, praedator). </sense><sense id="n40413.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40413.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fluvius) rapidus raptori pueri subduxit pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis et peni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalami mei, i. e. uxoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 627" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: ferri, <hi rend="ital">that draws</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attracts to itself</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the magnet</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 4. — </sense><sense id="n40413.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: lupi raptores, <hi rend="ital">robbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 540</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40413.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapta et raptores tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 9, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:26:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus, i. e. lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratus raptae raptor fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>ravisher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 680</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 52, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:4" default="NO">7, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium raptor vertit in fallaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40413.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptores alieni honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam defuturos raptores Italicae libertatis lupos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raptorius: <entryFree id="n40414" type="hapax" key="rapto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for dragging away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
raptrix: <entryFree id="n40415" type="hapax" key="raptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>raptor</etym>, <sense id="n40415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that carries off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravishes</hi>: aquila (that carried off Ganymede), Hier. Chron.</sense></entryFree>
raptum: <entryFree id="n40416" type="main" key="raptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n40416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">robbery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, etc., v. rapio, I. O. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
raptus: <entryFree id="n40417" type="main" key="raptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from rapio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40418" type="main" key="raptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n40418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying off by force.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40418.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Inoo lacerata est altera raptu,</quote> <trans><tr>violent rending</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">runcinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenes cucurbitarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp. <hi rend="ital">a jerking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cramp</hi> in the limbs (med. t. t.): <cit><quote lang="la">raptus omnium membrorum ex cerebri membranis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:3:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 37</bibl>, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spasmo/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:10:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 74</bibl>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n40418.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a carrying off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praedam et raptus congregare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptus exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40418.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of persons, <hi rend="ital">an abduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis de Ganymedi raptu dubitat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginis (Proserpinae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:417" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 417</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; claud. Rapt. Pros. 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>
rapulum: <entryFree id="n40419" type="main" key="ra_pu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rapum</etym>, <sense id="n40419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little turnip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rapum: <entryFree id="n40420" type="main" key="ra_pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(a/fh, r(afa/nh</foreign></etym> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rāpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 176" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:177" default="NO">177</bibl>), <sense id="n40420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turnip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rape</hi>: Brassica rapa, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:22 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 33, § 125</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">flung at one as an insult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40420.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A knob</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lump</hi> formed by the roots of a tree: <cit><quote lang="la">magnarum arborum truncos cum rapo suo transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 86:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 86, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rare: <entryFree id="n40421" type="main" key="ra_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rarus <sense id="n40421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rarefacio: <entryFree id="n40422" type="main" key="ra_re_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārē-făcĭo</orth> (written also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">rārē făcĭo</orth>), <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rarus</etym>, <sense id="n40422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make thin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rarefy</hi> (Lucret.): <cit><quote lang="la">rarefieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 442</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rareque facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:870" default="NO" valid="yes">870</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rarenter: <entryFree id="n40423" type="main" key="ra_renter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rarus <sense id="n40423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
raresco: <entryFree id="n40424" type="main" key="ra_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n40424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [rarus], <hi rend="ital">to grow thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose its density</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be rarefied</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n40424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgit item cum rarescunt quoque nubila caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 214</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:186" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor aquai ab aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:875" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 875</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rarescit terra calore,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 841</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 865</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:892" default="NO" valid="yes">892</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">resolutaque tellus In liquidas rarescit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedibus senectute lanae rarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40424.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarescunt alta colonis Maenala,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>become empty</tr>, <tr>depopulated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:284" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 284</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia densae Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: rarescit<cb n="RARU" />  multo laxatus vulnere miles, <hi rend="ital">the ranks grow thin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 423</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:382" default="NO">5, 382</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rarescunt cuspide pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:617" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae rarescentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:343" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 343</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 74</bibl>: ubi angusti rarescent claustra Pelori, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shall open themselves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow wider</hi>, i. q. laxabuntur, patebunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 411</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">colles paulatim rarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40424.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus rarescit,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes feeble</tr>, <tr>diminishes</tr>, <tr>dies away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 14), 35: <cit><quote lang="la">quod justitia rarescit, iniquitas increbrescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita justitia rarescet, ita impietas et avaritia crebrescent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ibis efficit, ut rarescant mortiferae pestes absumptae,</quote> <trans><tr>become rare</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26, 3, 1</bibl>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 246</bibl>, the read. varies between rarescit and rorescit.)</sense></entryFree>
raripilus: <entryFree id="n40425" type="hapax" key="ra_ri^pi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārĭ-pĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rarus</etym>, <sense id="n40425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thinhaired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprinum pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 26.</sense></entryFree>
raritas: <entryFree id="n40426" type="main" key="ra_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of being loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not dense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looseness of texture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distance apart</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n40426.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pulmonibus inest raritas quaedam et assimilis spongiis mollitudo ad hauriendum spiritum aptissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(asini) nec pontes transeunt, per raritatem eorum translucentibus fluviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">foraminum raritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40426.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">small number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fewness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillorum,</quote> <trans><tr>thinness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">superciliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum (opp. multitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remanentium (hominum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 13, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raritas dictorum distinguet oratorem a scurrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 247</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in raritate videre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 28</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40426.3" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a rarity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandro equi magna raritas contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">raritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raritudo: <entryFree id="n40427" type="main" key="ra_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">looseness</hi> (rare form for raritas): <cit><quote lang="la">rete a raritudine (dictum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 130</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocri raritudine terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raro: <entryFree id="n40428" type="main" key="ra_ro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rarus <sense id="n40428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rarungae: <entryFree id="n40429" type="main" key="Rarungae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rarungae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rarus: <entryFree id="n40430" type="main" key="ra_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. root rah-, to abandon</etym>, <sense id="n40430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having wide interstices between its parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a loose texture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not thick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi> (opp. densus; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n40430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">denseri poterunt ignes, rarique relinqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 656</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) Rara sit an supra morem si densa requiras ... Densa magis Cereri, rarissima quaeque Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:227 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 227 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">textura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 196</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rariores silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>the thinner</tr>, <tr>clearer parts of the forest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (opp. solidae res),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 347</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:860" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 860</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:631 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 631 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 107</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1024" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1024</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>with the fingers spread apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raraque non fracto vestigia pulvere pendent,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>scarcely visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:640" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 640</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40430.3" n="A" level="2"> Of things which stand apart from each other, <hi rend="ital">far apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scattered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanty</hi> ( = disjectus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. densus, confertus): cum raris disjectisque ex aedificiis pabulum conquireretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vides habitari in terrā raris et angustis in locis,</quote> <trans><tr>scattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:19:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 19, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparent rari nantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacae expanduntur rarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices in vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 111</bibl></cit>; cf. capillus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">racemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 600</bibl></cit> et saep. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manat rara meas lacrima per genas,</quote> <trans><tr>drop by drop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40430.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in military lang., <hi rend="ital">far apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scattered about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispersed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straggling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi> (opp. confertus). accedebat huc, ut numquam conferti, sed rari magnisque intervallis proeliarentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rari in confertos illati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi ex silvis rari propugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 45</bibl>; 7, 80; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnites raris ordinibus constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara est acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarior acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarior acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: ut ordines suos non magnopere servarent. <pb n="1525" /> <cb n="RARU" /> rari dispersique pugnarent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40430.5" n="B" level="2"> Of any thing found in small numbers or which seldom takes place, <hi rend="ital">few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi> (cf. paucus): <cit><quote lang="la">in omni arte ... ut in ipsă virtute, optimum quidque rarissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum genus (amicorum) et quidem omnia praeclara rara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raris ac prope nullis portibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi rarus ejus rei, nonnullus tamen usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarus enim est animus ad ea defendenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">Idem rarum est, non sine usu tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rari domos, plurimi amicorum tecta ... petivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus raris ab orbe nostro navibus aditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquod solitarium aut rarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:44:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 44, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut anteponantur rara vulgaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara hostium apparebant arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (littera) est apud nos rarissima in clausulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est magis rarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex maxime raro genere hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raris vocibus hisco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara per ignotos errent animalia montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiet pugnas vitio parentum Rara juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>. —Rarum est, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:38" default="NO">6, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:24" default="NO">10, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum dictu, esse aliquid, cui prosit neglegentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 39, § 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40430.6" n="b" level="4"> Mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for the <pos>adv.</pos> raro, <hi rend="ital">seldom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Iliacos coetus nisi rarus adibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 766</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rarus, qui tam procul a portu recessisset, reperiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 3; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rarus fuit, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquis scriptoribus rarus obtrectator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:22, p. 233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 22, p. 233</bibl> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar rarus egressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">leones rari in potu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(calculus) rarus inventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 217</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">helxine rara visu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus alias circa picturas pigmentaque rarus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rarely speaks of them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 38, § 115</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40430.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in partic., <hi rend="ital">uncommon of its kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara puella fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministra deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 52;
