cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rara quidem facie, sed rarior arte canendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 93</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis (sc. pavo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 35, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis opus rarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulis rarissima ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarissima turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarissimi ingenii homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux rarissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, usually raro (class.), but sometimes rare (ante - class. and postAug.), rarenter (ante- and post - class.), or rariter (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n40430.8" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rārō</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">raro nimium dabat quod biberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potavi, edi, donavi, et enim id raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id, quod raro fit, fieri omnino negetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:43:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 43, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evenire insolenter et raro (opp. vulgo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum aegrotis prodest raro, nocet saepissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 101</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen raro habet in oratione poeticum aliquod verbum dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raro antecedentem scelestum Deseruit poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: admodum raro, Cic. Fat. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which we find raro admodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 50, 51, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raro umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:22" default="NO">5, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 55</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si rarius fiet, quam tu exspectabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istud rarissime accidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non affari nisi rarissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40430.9" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rārē</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">far apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thinly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi rare conseritur, vanam et minutam spicam facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui vimine rarius contextus saccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40430.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B.) Of time, <hi rend="ital">seldom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vero rare capitur (piscis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40430.11" n="C" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rārenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">seldom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato rarenter bibere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 103</bibl></cit>; so, rarenter, Liv. And., Enn., Caecil., Nov., Trab., Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 515, 23 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">164, 25</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357, 22</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40430.12" n="D" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rārĭter</orth> (very <cb n="RATI" /> rare): quidquid fit rariter, magis delectat, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rasamen: <entryFree id="n40431" type="hapax" key="ra_sa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rado</etym>, <sense id="n40431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is scraped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shaved off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scraping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaving</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
rasilis: <entryFree id="n40432" type="main" key="ra_si^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scraped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, = levigatus (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">torno rasile buxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 318</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:658" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 658</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calathi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vessels without raised work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:176" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of the bark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 206</bibl></cit>: scopuli, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without herbage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 3, 69.</sense></entryFree>
rasio: <entryFree id="n40433" type="main" key="ra_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scraping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strigilis rasio est adhibenda corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rasis: <entryFree id="n40434" type="main" key="ra_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of raw pitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rasito: <entryFree id="n40435" type="main" key="ra_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shave often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shave</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">faciem cotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rasores: <entryFree id="n40436" type="gloss" key="ra_so_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsōres</orth> <itype>fidicines dicti, quia videntur chordas ictu radere</itype> (qs. <sense id="n40436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scrapers of the strings</hi>), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=275:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 275, 2</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=274:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 274, 13</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
rasta: <entryFree id="n40437" type="foreign" key="rasta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rasta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Germ.; O. H. Germ. rasta or rast, rest; Goth. rasta, a mile; cf. the Slav. werst</etym>, <sense id="n40437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German measure of a mile</hi> (late Lat.), Hier. in Joel, 3, 18.</sense></entryFree>
rastellus: <entryFree id="n40438" type="main" key="rastellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rastellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rastrum</etym>, <sense id="n40438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mattock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:31:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 31, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl> (for which, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 27</bibl>, rastra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raster: <entryFree id="n40439" type="main" key="raster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, v. rastrum <sense id="n40439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rastrarius: <entryFree id="n40440" type="main" key="rastra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rastrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rastrum</etym>, <sense id="n40440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hoe</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to husbandry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a country life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hypobolimaea,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a comedy of Cæcilius</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">89, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
rastrum: <entryFree id="n40441" type="main" key="rastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, usually in <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ra-stri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (so <case>nom.</case> rastri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 36</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> rastros, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 58 al.</bibl>; but rastra, Cels. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 15, 166</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:589" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 589</bibl>) [rado], <sense id="n40441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a toothed hoe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rake</hi>, used for breaking up the soil, <hi rend="ital">a mattock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rastris glebas qui frangit inertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva obnoxia rastris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 439</bibl></cit>; 3, 534; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rastris terram domat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera Rastrorum fert tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rastros quadridentes, Cato, l. l.: ligneis rastris sarriendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Comically spoken of as the comb of Polyphemus, with the sickle as his razor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 765</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: si illi pergo suppeditare sumptibus, mihi illaec vero ad rastros res redit, <hi rend="ital">it will bring me to the hoe</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I shall be reduced to work for my living</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rasura: <entryFree id="n40442" type="main" key="ra_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40442.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a scraping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shaving</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbae capitisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40442.1" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">what is scraped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shaved off; a scraping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl> (4), 8, 8.— </sense><sense id="n40442.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulae,</quote> <trans><tr>the harsh pronunciation of the gutturals by the Orientals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ep. Paul. ad Tit. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rasus: <entryFree id="n40443" type="main" key="ra_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from rado.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40444" type="hapax" key="ra_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rado</etym>, <sense id="n40444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scraping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab rasu rastelli dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
rataneum: <entryFree id="n40445" type="main" key="Rataneum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rataneum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n40445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ratariae: <entryFree id="n40446" type="main" key="ra^ta_ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătārĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ratis</etym>, <sense id="n40446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small vessels made of logs fastened together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rafts</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; also called ratiariae in <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 43</bibl>; cf. ratiarius.</sense></entryFree>
ratiarius: <entryFree id="n40447" type="main" key="ra^ti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n40447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raftsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lighterman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 67, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ratihabitio: <entryFree id="n40448" type="main" key="ra^ti^ha^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭhăbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ratum-habeo</etym>, <sense id="n40448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an approval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratification</hi> (jurid.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:6:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:152 al" default="NO">50, 17, 152 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ratio: <entryFree id="n40449" type="main" key="ra^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> rationi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 66</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>reor, ratus</etym>, <sense id="n40449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40449.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.: Les.</hi> Nequaquam argenti ratio conparet tamen. <hi rend="ital">Sta.</hi> Ratio quidem hercle adparet: argentum <foreign lang="greek">oi)/xetai,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 15 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem putare ... bene ratio accepti atque expensi inter nos convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">146</bibl>; cf.: ad calculos vocare amicitiam,<cb n="RATI" />  ut par sit ratio acceptorum et datorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itur, putatur ratio cum argentario ... Ubi disputata est ratio cum argentario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 53 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera digitis rationem computat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna ratio C. Verruci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">direptio ejus pecuniae, cujus ratio in aede Opis confecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in tabulis nominatim, ratio confecta erat, qui numerus domo exisset, etc., ... Quarum omnium rerum summa erat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: auri ratio constat: aurum in aerario est, <hi rend="ital">the account agrees</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is correct</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl> (v. consto): <cit><quote lang="la">decumo post mense, ut rationem te dictare intellego,</quote> <trans><tr>to make the reckoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit> (al. ductare): <cit><quote lang="la">rationem ducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a computation</tr>, <tr>to compute</tr>, <tr>calculate</tr>, <tr>reckon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>; so, rationem habere, <hi rend="ital">to take an account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a computation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus omnis pecuniae conjunctim ratio habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">piratarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem inire,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast up</tr>, <tr>reckon</tr>, <tr>calculate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor minae periere, ut ratio redditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ego rationem reddam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem repetere de pecuniis repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 37, 104</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Quanta istaec hominum summa est? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Septem millia. <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Tantum esse oportet: <cit><quote lang="la">recte rationem tenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">drachumae, quas de ratione debuisti,</quote> <trans><tr>according to the account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandem (pecuniam) quemadmodum in rationem inducerent, non videbant,</quote> <trans><tr>how they should bring it into their accounts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: rationes putare argentariam, frumentariam, pabuli causā quae parata sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">rationem vinariam, oleariam, quid venierit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes ad aerarium continuo detuli ... quas rationes si cognoris, intelleges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rationes cum publicanis putarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes a colono accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus est? inquam. Rationes conferatis. Assidunt, subducunt, ad nummum convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes referre ... rationes deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani pueri longis rationibus assem Discunt in partes centum diducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 325</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">A RATIONIBVS,</quote> <trans><tr>an accountant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1494</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2973</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2986</bibl>; 4173 et saep. (cf. ab).— </sense><sense id="n40449.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40449.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">register</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cedo rationem carceris, quae diligentissime conficitur, quo quisque die datus in custodiam, quo mortuus, quo necatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes imperii, ab Augusto proponi solitas, sed a Tiberio intermissas, publicavit (sc. Caligula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit> ( = breviarium) totius imperii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 101 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationarium imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40449.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc lenonum et scortorum plus est fere Quam olim muscarum est. Ea nimia est ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro ratione pecuniae liberalius est Brutus tractatus quam Pompeius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. II. B. 1. c. infra.— </sense><sense id="n40449.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A business matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affair</hi>, in gen. (a favorite word of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">res rationesque eri Ballionis curo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res rationesque vestrorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re ac ratione cum aliquo conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de totà illā ratione atque re Gallicanā inter se multa communicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Druides) in reliquis fere rebus, publicis privatisque rationibus, Graecis utantur litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit> (metaphrast. <foreign lang="greek">pra/gmasi</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio nummaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeraria ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio domestica ... bellica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad popularem rationem attinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes familiares componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fori judiciique rationem Messala suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in explicandis rationibus rerum civilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantos aestus habet ratio comitiorum ... nihil fallacius ratione totā comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter rationem Gallici belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 14, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnem rationem humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>: in hac ratione quid res, quid causa, quid tempus ferat, tu facillime perspicies,<cb n="RATI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rationem existimabam satis aptam naturam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl></cit>, A, 1.—</sense><sense id="n40449.8" n="b" level="4"> Pregn.: meae (tuae, etc.) rationes, <hi rend="ital">my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi> (cf. in Engl. to find one's account in any thing): <cit><quote lang="la">me ad ejus rationes adjungo, quem tu in meis rationibus tibi esse adjungendum putasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum meis alienissimum rationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Corn. Fragm. 1, 7</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">consideres, quid tuae rationes postulent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: servitia repudiabat ... alienum suis rationibus existimans videri causam civium cum servis fugitivis communicasse, <hi rend="ital">inconsistent with his policy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interests</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si meas rationes unquam vestrae saluti anteposuissem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Red. ad Quir. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40449.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam hanc rationem cordi ventrique edidi,</quote> <trans><tr>presented this reckoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itidem hic ut Acheronti ratio accepti scribitur,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>things are taken only</tr>, <tr>nothing is given back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen (comoediae) jam habetis, nunc rationes ceteras Accipite,</quote> <trans><tr>an account of the rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">census quom sum, juratori recte rationem dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rationem dare, for the more usual rationem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 86</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 92</bibl> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">(argentarii) ratione utuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>make a reckoning</tr>, <tr>settle up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eam mecum rationem puto,</quote> <trans><tr>go into that calculation</tr>, <tr>think over the matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra egomet mecum has rationes puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Medea et Atreus) inita subductaque ratione nefaria scelera meditantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod posteaquam iste cognovit hanc rationem habere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>to make the following calculation</tr>, <tr>reflection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:39:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 39, § 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: totius rei consilium his rationibus explicavit, ut si, etc., ... si, etc., ... sin, etc., <hi rend="ital">drew the plan of the whole undertaking according to the following calculation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 78</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and herewith cf.: rationem consilii mei accipite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut habere rationem possis, quo loco me convenias, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>that you may calculate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ita vivamus, ut rationem reddendam nobis arbitremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, quod minus ferendum sit, quam rationem ab altero vitae reposcere eum, qui non possit suae reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: si gravius quid acciderit, abs te rationem reposcent,</quote> <trans><tr>will call you to account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: clarorum virorum atque magnorum non minus otii, quam negotii rationem exstare oportere, <hi rend="ital">an account must be capable of being given</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam otii quam negotii rationem reddere majores censuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: eam condicionem esse imperandi, ut non aliter ratio constet, quam si uni reddatur, <hi rend="ital">that the account is not correct unless</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum est quam singulis diebus in urbe ratio aut constet aut constare videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 5, 16</bibl> et saep.; cf. Just. praef. 5.—</sense><sense id="n40449.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40449.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi> to a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">(agricolae) habent rationem cum terrā, quae nunquam recusat imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>have an account</tr>, <tr>have to do</tr>, <tr>have dealings with the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ratio cum Orco habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ubi sit cum Orco ratio ponenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnibus Musis rationem habere cogito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hac (muliere) aliquid adulescentem hominem habuisse rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl>. omnes, quibuscum ratio huic aut est aut fuit, assunt, defendunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 75</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">. quae ratio tibi cum eo intercesserat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis vero quae potest esse cum eo ratio, in quo est incredibilis crudelitas, fides nulla?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si habenda cum M. Antonii latrocinio pacis ratio fuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes ad nostrorum annalium rationem veteres, ad ipsorum sane recentes,</quote> <trans><tr>in respect to our annals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 13, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.12" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care</hi> for a thing (usu. in the connection habere and ducere alicujus rei rationem): ad hanc rationem quoniam maximam vim natura habet, fortuna proximam: utriusque omnino habenda ratio est in deligendo genere <cb n="RATI" /> vitae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (civium Romanorum) nobis pro vestrā sapientiā, Quirites, habenda est ratio diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deos) piorum et impiorum habere rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus absentis rationem haberi proximis comitiis populus jussisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">absentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; 3, 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sauciorum et aegrorum habitā ratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneret, frumenti rationem esse habendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:34" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (al. frumentandi), rationem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl></cit> Oud.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus vel dignitatis vel commodi rationem non habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: ut summae rei publicae rationem habeamus, Pompeius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, c, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus salutis rationem habere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to regard</tr>, <tr>care for</tr>, <tr>be concerned about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissimae fugae rationem habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ceteris habenda ratio non sui solum sed etiam aliorum, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde habeat rationem posteritatis et periculi sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere nunc se rationem officii pro beneficiis Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ullius rationem sui commodi ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hujusce periculi tum ceterorum quoque officiorum et amicitiarum ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis hac in re habenda ratio et diligentia est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">didici ex tuis litteris, te omnibus in rebus habuisse rationem, ut mihi consuleres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo rationem, quid a populo Romano acceperim,</quote> <trans><tr>bring into consideration</tr>, <tr>consider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut habere rationem possis, quo loco me salvā lege Corneliā convenias, ego veni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illud rationis habuisti, eam provinciam ad summam stultitiam nequitiamque venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc rationis habebant, facere eos nullo modo posse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>, § 70.— </sense><sense id="n40449.13" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Relation</hi> to a thing, i. e. </sense><sense id="n40449.14" n="(a)" level="5"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procedure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">method</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>, etc. (cf. consilium): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sic rationem incipissam, hanc instituam astutiam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 175</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cenas hodic, si hanc rationem instituis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua ratio est, ut secundum binos ludos mihi respondere incipias: mea, ut ante primos ludos comperendinem. Ita fiet, ut tua ista ratio existimetur astuta, meum hoc consilium necessarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio viaque defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque in praesentia Pompeii insequendi rationem omittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea autem ratio in dicendo haec esse solet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in philosophiā ratio contra omnia disserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 56</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot ante annis inita ratio est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quo primum occurreretur, vix ratio iniri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia reponendarum (tegularum) nemo artifex inire rationem potuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc aditu laudis non mea me voluntas sed meae vitae rationes ab ineunte aetate susceptae prohibuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>plan of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rationibus rerum publicarum aut constituendarum aut tuendarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Object., <hi rend="ital">relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way</hi>, etc. (cf. modus): <cit><quote lang="la">sed ratio ordoque agminis aliter se habebat ac Belgae ad Nervios detulerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut rei militaris ratio atque ordo postulabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rei militaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio atque usus belli,</quote> <trans><tr>the art and practice of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17</bibl> et saep. al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novae rationes bellandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio equestris proelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum operum haec erat ratio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: rationem pontis hanc instituit; <cit><quote lang="la">tigna bina, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit per omnium vitas amicitia, nec ullam aetatis degendae rationem patitur esse expertem sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ratio comparata est vitae naturaeque nostrae, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas (Platonis) non quae possit esse, sed in quā ratio rerum civilium perspici posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 52 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui disseruerunt de generibus et de rationibus civitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 8, 13: quam creberrimis litteris faciam ut tibi nota sit omnis ratio dierum atque itinerum meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: quoniam eadem <cb n="RATI" /> est ratio juris in utroque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec eadem ratio est in summā totius Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab nostris eadem ratione, quā pridie, resistitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 100</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docet, longe aliā ratione esse bellum gerendum atque antea sit gestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si Romae fieri posset, certe aliquā ratione expugnasset iste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid refert, quā me ratione cogatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fuit illis conandum atque omni ratione efficiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 67</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simili ratione Pompeius in suis castris consedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium ferri nullā ratione poterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quibus rationibus superare possent, sed quem ad modum uti victoriā deberent, cogitabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 83</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 58; 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n40449.16" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> in circumlocution for the <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> itself (v. Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">678): vereor ne oratio mea alienā ab judiciorum ratione esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa autem propter rationem brevitatis praetermittenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">103: quantas perturbationes et quantos aestus habet ratio comitiorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fallacius ratione totā comitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicere tempestatum rationem et praedonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota ratio talium largitionum genere vitiosa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.17" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">that faculty of the mind which forms the basis of computation and calculation</hi>, and hence of <hi rend="ital">mental action</hi> in general, i. e. <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>: duplex est vis animorum atque natura: una pars in appetitu posita est, quae est <foreign lang="greek">o(rmh\</foreign> Graece, quae hominem huc et illuc rapit; <cit><quote lang="la">altera in ratione, quae docet et explanat, quid faciendum, quid fugiendum sit. Ita fit, ut ratio praesit, appetitus obtemperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, quod rationis est particeps, per quam consequentia cernit, causas rerum videt earumque progressus et quasi antecessiones non ignorat, similitudines comparat rebusque praesentibus adjungit atque annectit futuras, facile totius vitae cursum videt ad eamque degendam praeparat res necessarias. Eademque natura vi rationis hominem concilia homini et ad orationis et ad vitae societatem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud scio, an melius fuerit, humano generi motum istum celerem cogitationis, acumen, sollertiam, quam rationem vocamus, non dari omnino quam tam munifice et tam large dari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex est ratio summa, insita in naturā, quae jubet ea, quae facienda sunt, prohibetque contraria. Eadem ratio, cum est in hominis mente confirmata et confecta, lex est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quos ratio non posset, eos ad officium religio duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens et ratio et consilium in senibus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pudor quaeritur, si probitas, si fides, Mancinus haec attulit, si ratio, consilium, prudentia, Pompeius antistat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">si ratio et prudentia curas aufert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in rebus temeritas et casus, non ratio nec consilium valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa de urbis situ revoces ad rationem quae a Romulo casu aut necessitate facta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">moneo ut agentem te ratio ducat, non fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: mulier abundat audaciā; <cit><quote lang="la">consilio et ratione deficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 65, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariovistum magis ratione et consilio quam virtute vicisse. Cui rationi contra homines barbaros locus fuisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: arma amens capio; <cit><quote lang="la">nec sat rationis in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis egens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 299</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia dissidens a ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora quam hominum ratio consequi possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ratione provideri poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumque in ratione esset, exploratum habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec majore ratione bellum administrari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minari divisoribus ratio non erat,</quote> <trans><tr>it was not reasonable</tr>, <tr>was contrary to reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; so, nulla ratio est, with an <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 15</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, minime rationis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellianus exercitús, cui acquiescere Cremonae ratio fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>which</tr>, <tr>as reason dictated</tr>, <tr>ought to have rested at Cremona</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod domi te inclusisti, ratione fecisti,</quote> <trans><tr>reasonably</tr>, <tr>sensibly</tr>, <tr>judiciously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1527" /> <cb n="RATI" /> 14, 3.—</sense><sense id="n40449.18" n="b" level="4"> The <hi rend="ital">reasonable cause</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">a ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio est causa, quae demonstrat, verum esse id, quod intendimus, brevi subjectione. Rationis confirmatio est ea, quae pluribus argumentis corroborat breviter expositam rationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tandem habuit argumenti aut rationis res, quamobrem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra confirmare argumentis ac rationibus: deinde contraria refutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noverit orator argumentorum et rationum locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 14, 44</bibl></cit> (v. also argumentum): <cit><quote lang="la">si mei consilii causam rationemque cognoverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam sententiam cum reliquis causis haec quoque ratio eos deduxit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam habet rationem, non quaero aequitatis, sed ipsius improbitatis atque impudentiae? ... facti, si non bonam, at aliquam rationem afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 196</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde nihil rationis affert, quamobrem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deest hoc loco copia rationum, quibus docere velitis, humanas esse formas deorum: primum quod, etc. ... deinde quod, etc. ... tertiam rationem affertis, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quidem, cur sic opinetur, rationem subicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco minus existimo te nihil nisi summā ratione fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, § <cit><quote lang="la">5: nunc non modo agendi rationem nullam habeo, sed ne cogitandi quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes in eā disputatione a te collectae vetabant me rei publicae penitus diffidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationibus conquisitis de voluptate et dolore disputandum putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum disputando rationibusque docuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rationibus tam certis tamque illustribus opponuntur ab his, qui contra disputant primum labores, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">num parva causa aut prava ratio est?</quote> <trans><tr>reason</tr>, <tr>excuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.19" n="(b)" level="5"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a showing cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasoning</hi> in support of a proposition: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio est, quae continet causam, quae si sublata sit, nihil in causā controversiae relinquatur, hoc modo: Orestes si accusetur matricidii, nisi hoc dicat, Jure feci, illa enim patrem meum occiderat, non habet defensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad propositum subjecta ratio, et item in distributis supposita ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:1" default="NO">5, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>; 7, 8, 3.—</sense><sense id="n40449.20" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Reasonableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propriety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conformity</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus, quae ratione docentur et via, primum constituendum est, quid quidque sit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in a reasonable</tr>, <tr>regular manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 33, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ratione et viā procedat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo et ratione aliquid facere (along with recte atque ordine facere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res Nec modum habet neque consilium, ratione modoque Tractari non vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, quod ratione et numero moveri possit sine consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallis imparibus, sed tamen pro ratā parte ratione distinctis,</quote> <trans><tr>divided proportionally by rule</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex summis et infimis et mediis interjectis ordinibus ut sonis moderatā ratione civitas concinit,</quote> <trans><tr>in symmetrical proportion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo defuit fortasse ratio, sed tamen vincit ipsa rerum publicarum natura saepe rationem,</quote> <trans><tr>order</tr>, <tr>system</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 5, 7: declinatio si cum ratione fiet,</quote> <trans><tr>reasonably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio et distributio,</quote> <trans><tr>a reasonable division</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.21" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A theory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doctrine</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">system</hi> based upon reason; <hi rend="ital">science</hi>, and (less freq.), subject., <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat enim tunc haec nova et ignota ratio, solem lunae oppositum solere deficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nova et a nobis inventa ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 39, 66: si animum contulisti in istam rationem et quasi artem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes tacito quodam sensu sine ullā arte aut ratione, quae sint in artibus ac rationibus recta ac prava dijudicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continet enim totam hanc quaestionem ea ratio, quae est de naturā deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri ratio, quae plerisque notissima est,</quote> <trans><tr>doctrine</tr>, <tr>system</tr>, <tr>philosophy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum ratio disciplinaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynicorum ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl>: ratio vivendi ... ratio civilis et disciplina populorum, <cb n="RATI" /> <hi rend="ital">the art of living ... statesmanship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi cui videbitur illa in optimis studiis et artibus quieta vitae ratio beatior, haec civilis laudabilior est certe et illustrior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improba navigii ratio tum caeca jacebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1004</bibl></cit>: saltationis ac musicae rationis studiosi, Col. prooem. § 3 al.—Subject., <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua (est in me) exercitatio dicendi aut si hujus rei ratio aliqua, ab optimarum artium studiis ac disciplinā profecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40449.22" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A view</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi> resting upon reasonable grounds: <cit><quote lang="la">mea sic est ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inventus est nemo, cujus non haec et sententia esset et oratio, non esse metuendum, etc. ... Haec cum omnes sentirent et cum in eam rationem pro suo quisque sensu ac dolore loqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=68 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 68 sq.</bibl></cit>; and with this cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ratio etsi non valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 6</bibl></cit> (just before: hujus cum sententiam plurimi essent secuti).— </sense><sense id="n40449.23" n="f" level="4"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">a production of proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argumentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasoning</hi>: (Epicurus) tollit definitiones; nihil de dividendo ac partiendo docet; <cit><quote lang="la">non, quo modo efficiatur concludaturque ratio, tradit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio ipsa coget, et ex aeternitate quaedam esse vera et ea non esse nexa causis aeternis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo, ubi tyrannus est, ibi non vitiosam ut heri dicebam, sed, ut nunc ratio cogit, dicendum est, plane nullam esse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ratiocinabiliter: <entryFree id="n40450" type="hapax" key="ra^ti^o_ci^na_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōcĭnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ratiocinor</etym>, <sense id="n40450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">according to correct computation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ratiocinatio: <entryFree id="n40451" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_ci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōcĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, a rhet. and archit. t. t. <sense id="n40451.0" n="I" level="1"> In rhet. </sense><sense id="n40451.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An exercise of the reasoning powers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm reasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratiocination</hi> (opp. impulsio, a passionate feeling, impulse; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio): ratiocinatio est diligens et considerata faciendi aliquid aut non faciendi excogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam sapientiae studiosos maxime medicos esse, si ratiocinatio hoc faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 49.—</sense><sense id="n40451.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A certain form of reasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratiocinatio est oratio ex ipsā re probabile aliquid eliciens, quod expositum et per se cognitum, suā se vi et ratione confirmet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex alio colligitur aliud, nec improprium nec inusitatum nomen est ratiocinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:15" default="NO">3, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:5 al" default="NO">5, 14, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40451.3" n="3" level="3"> A rhet. figure, <hi rend="ital">reasoning in an interrogative form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratiocinatio est, per quam ipsi a nobis rationem poscimus, quare quidque dicamus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40451.4" n="II" level="1"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">theory</hi> (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrica, practice): ratiocinatio est, quae res fabricatas solertiā ac ratione proportionis demonstrare atque explicare potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes">15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
