ratiocinativus: <entryFree id="n40452" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_ci^na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōcĭnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40452.0" n="I" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to reasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syllogistic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratiocinative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:61" default="NO">61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:6" default="NO">5, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40452.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram.: ratiocinativa conjunctio, <hi rend="ital">serving for inference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illative</hi>, as ergo, igitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 410</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
ratiocinator: <entryFree id="n40453" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōcĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accountant</hi>, i. q. calculator. </sense><sense id="n40453.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40453.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut boni ratiocinatores esse possimus et addendo deducendoque videre, quae reliqui summa fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 5.</sense></entryFree>
ratiocinium: <entryFree id="n40454" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:6" default="NO">5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:13" default="NO">5, 11, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod. Th. 8, 1, 6: publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:16:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40454.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The obligation to render an account</hi>: imponere, Cod. 2, 7, 6 al.</sense></entryFree>
ratiocinor: <entryFree id="n40455" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n40455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [ratio] (rare, but good prose). </sense><sense id="n40455.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculate</hi>: in summo apud illos (sc. Graecos) honore geometria fuit: itaque nihil mathematicis illustrius; <cit><quote lang="la">at nos metiendi ratiocinandique utilitate hujus artis terminavimus modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pecuniā ratiocinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40455.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40455.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto cum illis occipiam, id ratiocinor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii profecto ratiocinati essent quid possent facere, si quidem suā sponte facerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40455.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to infer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi> from a <cb n="RATI" /> consideration of circumstances: <cit><quote lang="la">id ex partibus juris sumi oportebit et ratiocinari, quid in similibus rebus fieri soleat, et videre, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim sic ratiocinabantur ... aperte jam ac perspicue nulla esse judicia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 55</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores atque parsimoniam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rationabilis: <entryFree id="n40456" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ratio</etym> (post-Aug.; = rationalis, which is in better use), <sense id="n40456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rational</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes quae ad rationabilem animum pertinent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 17, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes rationabiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsio rationabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationabile sine dolo lac,</quote> <trans><tr>the pure milk of reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia vera et rationabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationabilius esse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:3:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭō-nābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rationally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasonably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 39, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ep. 61, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rationabilitas: <entryFree id="n40457" type="hapax" key="ra^ti^o_na_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rationabilis</etym>, <sense id="n40457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reasonableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rationality</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rationabiliter: <entryFree id="n40458" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_na_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rationabilis <sense id="n40458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rationalis: <entryFree id="n40459" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ratio</etym>. <sense id="n40459.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to accounts</hi> (post-Aug.): LITTERAE, Inscr. (a. p. Chr. 193) Orell. 39.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40459.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an accountant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receiver of revenue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasurer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 7</bibl>; Commod. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1090</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40459.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the oracular breastplate</hi> of the Jewish highpriest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 8, 8</bibl>; also called rationale judicii (transl. of LXX. <foreign lang="greek">to\ logei=on th=s kri/sews</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 28, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40459.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rational</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endowed with reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa est (finitio), si dicas, Equus est animal rationale: nam est equus animal, sed irrationale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo est animal rationale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 7</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nec si mutis finis voluptas, rationalibus quoque: quin immo ex contrario, quia mutis, ideo non rationalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 35</bibl></cit>; so without a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a rationali ad rationale (translatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40459.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Reasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depending on reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causā rationali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>logic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called rationalis pars philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: disciplina, i. e. <hi rend="ital">theoretical science</hi> (opp. to usus and experimenta), Cels. praef.; <cit><quote lang="la">also ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; hence, rationalis medicina, <hi rend="ital">theoretical therapeutics</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">and rationales medici,</quote> <trans><tr>medical theorists</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40459.5" n="2" level="3"> In rhet., i. q. ratiocinativus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a syllogism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syllogistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (quaestionum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:54" default="NO">6, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:78" default="NO">78</bibl>; 86; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:66" default="NO">66</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a reasonable manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasonably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rationally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 109" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
rationalitas: <entryFree id="n40460" type="hapax" key="ra^ti^o_na_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rationalis</etym>, <sense id="n40460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reasonableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rationality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet anima rationalitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
rationaliter: <entryFree id="n40461" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rationalis <sense id="n40461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rationarium: <entryFree id="n40462" type="main" key="ra^ti^o_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭōnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ratio</etym>, <sense id="n40462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a statistical table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">schedule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book of accounts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">breviarium imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ratis: <entryFree id="n40463" type="main" key="ra^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rătes</orth>, acc. to Prob. p. 1473 <sense id="n40463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; yet perh. we should here read vates; <case>acc.</case> ratim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 175" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 175</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ar-i-tras that which propels, an oar; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)re/ths</foreign>, rower; <foreign lang="greek">e)re/ssw</foreign>, to row; Lat.: remus, remigium, triremis, etc.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40463.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel made of logs fastened together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a raft</hi>: rates vocantur tigna colligata, quae per aquam aguntur; quo vocabulo interdum etiam naves significantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=272" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 272</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273:22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273, 22</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">nave primus in Graeciam ex Aegypto Danaus advenit, antea ratibus navigabatur inventis in mari Rubro inter insulas a rege Erythrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 206</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transeunt Rhenum navibus ratibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabibus verius quam ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratibus quibus junxerat flumen, nondum resolutis, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pontoons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam in rate in mari immenso nostra vehitur ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit> B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n40463.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A float</hi>: quasi pueris <pb n="1528" /> <cb n="RAUC" /> qui nare discunt, scirpea induitur ratis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40463.3" n="3" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">servavisti omnem ratem,</quote> <trans><tr>you have saved us from shipwreck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 27</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40463.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, in the poets, <hi rend="ital">a bark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vessel</hi>, in gen.: caeruleum spumat sale confertā rate pulsum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 659</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 378 Vahl.); Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 23</bibl> Müll.; Att. ap. Fest. s. v. rates, p. 272 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:121" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 192</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 53</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of Charon's boat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 302</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ratitus: <entryFree id="n40464" type="gloss" key="ra^ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ratis</etym>, <sense id="n40464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marked with the figure of a raft</hi>: ratitum quadrantem dictum putant, quod in eo et triente ratis fuerit effigies, ut navis in asse, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=275" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 275</bibl> Müll.; so, quadrantes, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 44</bibl> ib. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ratiuncula: <entryFree id="n40465" type="main" key="ra^ti^uncula"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătĭuncula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ratio</etym>. <sense id="n40465.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subduxi ratiunculam, Quantum aeris mihi sit, quantumque alieni siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40465.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slight ground</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic incredibili sententiae ratiunculas suggerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40465.2" n="2" level="3"> In dialectics, <hi rend="ital">a petty syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concludunt ratiunculas Stoici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: humanis ratiunculis falsis contravenire conantur, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
rato: <entryFree id="n40466" type="main" key="ra^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ratus</etym>, <sense id="n40466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ratumenaporta: <entryFree id="n40467" type="main" key="Ratume_na Porta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ratumēna Porta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ratumen-na</orth>). <sense id="n40467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gate at Rome</hi>, which, acc. to Festus, derived its name from an Etruscan youth, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=275" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 275</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 65, § 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45, 15</bibl> (in Plut. Public. 13, written <foreign lang="greek">*(ratoume/na</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
ratus: <entryFree id="n40468" type="main" key="ra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. reor <sense id="n40468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rauca: <entryFree id="n40469" type="main" key="rauca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rauca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of worm that breeds in oak-roots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raucedo: <entryFree id="n40470" type="gloss" key="rauce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>raucus</etym>, <sense id="n40470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarseness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raucedo amputatio vocis. Haec et arteriasis vocatur, eo quod raucam vocem et clausam reddat ab arteriarum injuriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raucesco: <entryFree id="n40471" type="main" key="raucesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow hoarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become hoarse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo raucescit vox (gallinae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 58" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raucidulus: <entryFree id="n40472" type="hapax" key="rauci^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">a little hoarse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 40, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raucio: <entryFree id="n40473" type="hapax" key="raucio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucio</orth>, no <sense id="n40473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be hoarse</hi>: rausuro tragicus qui carmina perdit Oreste, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 907</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
raucisonus: <entryFree id="n40474" type="main" key="rauci^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarsesounding</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">cantus cornicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1084" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1084</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bombi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raucitas: <entryFree id="n40475" type="main" key="rauci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40475.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hoarseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raucity</hi> (not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 184" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 53</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 104</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40475.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40475.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A snoring</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40475.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the <hi rend="ital">hoarse sound</hi> of the tuba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 269</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raucus: <entryFree id="n40476" type="main" key="raucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raucus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from root ru-, to make a loud noise, ravus</etym>, <sense id="n40476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40476.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rogitando sum raucus factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: expurigabo ad raucam ravim omnia, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos raucos saepe attentissime audiri video: at Aesopum, si paulum irrauserit, explodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 259</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palumbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicadae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1189</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">guttur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:433" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (ranarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulitas (picarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:678" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor (simiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaere peregrinum vicinia rauca reclamat,</quote> <trans><tr>screaming herself hoarse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 59</bibl></cit> Rup.: <cit><quote lang="la">causidici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Codrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors (Gallorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:514" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (puella) sonat raucum quiddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 289</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., of the swan: <cit><quote lang="la">dant sonitum rauci per stagna loquacia cygni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 458</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raucior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 704</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40476.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">hoarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deep sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, etc. (only in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 41: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 36: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 23: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa (tubae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 20; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aes (i. e. tuba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 71</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur (undae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. Hadria, Hor. <cb n="RAVI" /> C. 2, 14, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:291" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 49; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 50</bibl>: aes (i. e. scutum). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 545</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Rauca sonans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 125</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidus post flamina pontus Rauca gemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma raucum gemuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:245" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 245</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 289</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40476.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">te vero nolo, nisi ipse rumor jam raucus erit factus, ad Baias venire,</quote> <trans><tr>has become faint</tr>, <tr>died away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
raudiicampi: <entryFree id="n40477" type="main" key="Raudii campi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Raudii campi</orth>, <sense id="n40477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad plain near Verona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Marius defeated the Cimbri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl>.— Called also, in <number>sing.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rau-dius campus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>; Aur. Vict. Vir. Ill. c. 67.</sense></entryFree>
raudus: <entryFree id="n40478" type="main" key="raudus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">raudus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">rōdus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdus</orth>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with rudis; cf.: crudus, crudelis</etym>, <sense id="n40478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rude mass;</hi> hence, in partic., <hi rend="ital">a piece of brass</hi> used as a coin (an old word): <cit><quote lang="la">rodus vel raudus significat rem rudem et imperfectam. Nam saxum quoque raudus appellant poëtae, ut Attius in Menalippo: manibus rapere raudus saxeum grandem et gravem. Vulgus quidem in usu habuit non modo pro aere imperfecto, sed etiam pro signato ... in aestimatione censoriă aes infectum rudus appellatur, Fest. s. v. rodus, p. 265 Müll.: aes raudus dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=163" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 163</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">olim aera raudera dicebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">xalko\s a)ne/rgastos</foreign> rudus, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">sculptor ab eris Rudere decoctam consuevit fingere massam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rudera milites jacerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb.</sense></entryFree>
rauduscula: <entryFree id="n40479" type="main" key="Rauduscu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rauduscŭla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rauduscŭlāna porta</orth>, <sense id="n40479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gate at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to the ancient division of Servius Tullius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the</hi> P. Naevia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Lavernalis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=163" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 163</bibl> Müll.; Fest. s. h. v. p. 274 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
raudusculum: <entryFree id="n40480" type="main" key="rauduscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rauduscŭlum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">rōd-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūd-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>raudus</etym>. <sense id="n40480.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little piece of brass</hi> used as a coin (an old word): in mancipando cum dicitur: Rudusculo libram ferito, asse tangitur libra, Fest. s. v. rodus, p. 265 Müll.; v. raudus.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n40480.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small sum of money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de raudusculo Numeriano multum te amo,</quote> <trans><tr>in regard to that little debt of Numerius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de raudusculo quod scribis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, a, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
raunonia: <entryFree id="n40481" type="main" key="Rauno_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Raunōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island north of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 27, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rauraci: <entryFree id="n40482" type="main" key="Raura^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Raurăci</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Raurĭci</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighbors of the Helvetians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Basle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 75</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n40482.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raurăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the city of the Rauraci</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Augst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Basle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 6</bibl>: Rauriaca colonia, Plin. l. l.; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raurĭcum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">RAVRICA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 432</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40482.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Raurăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Rauraci</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia Rauraca = Rauracum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl></cit> (al. Rauriaca).</sense></entryFree>
ravenna: <entryFree id="n40483" type="main" key="Ra^venna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Răvenna</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Rāvenna</orth>, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 123</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated seaport in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, <hi rend="ital">still bearing the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:603" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:21 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 21 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40483.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Răven-nas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ravenna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> H 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MVNICIPIVM RAVENNAS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 707</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3790</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3792</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ravennati agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and also: agro Ravennate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 13, 8</bibl></cit>. — In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Răvennātes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ravenna</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 80, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, RAVENNATENSES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 399, 3</bibl></cit> (of A. D. 399).</sense></entryFree>
ravidus: <entryFree id="n40484" type="hapax" key="ra_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. ravus</etym>, <sense id="n40484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grayish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ravidi vel nigrantes oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ravilla: <entryFree id="n40485" type="main" key="Ra_villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rāvilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of</hi> L. Cassius Longinus (Cons. 626 A.U.C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ravillae a ravis oculis, quemadmodum a caesiis Caesullae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=274" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 274</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=275" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 275</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
ravio: <entryFree id="n40486" type="hapax" key="ra_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāvĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ravis</etym>, <sense id="n40486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to talk one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self hoarse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 33</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ravim, p. 275 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ravis: <entryFree id="n40487" type="main" key="ra_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāvis</orth>, <case>acc.</case> <itype>ravim</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with ravus, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n40487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarseness</hi> (ante- and post-class., and only occurring in the <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad ravim poscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: expurigabo<cb n="REAT" />  hercle omnia ad raucam ravim, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tragoedi) boando purgant ravim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ravulus: <entryFree id="n40488" type="hapax" key="ra_vu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāvŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n40488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. ravus], <hi rend="ital">a little hoarse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat ravulos choraulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ravus: <entryFree id="n40489" type="main" key="ra_vus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root ru-; Sanscr. aru-, to bellow; Lat. rudens, etc.; cf. raucus</etym>, <sense id="n40489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarse</hi>: rava vox rauca et parum liquida, proxime canum latratum sonans, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=283" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 283</bibl> Müll. So in only a single (post-class.) example: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere ravos Cantus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40490" type="main" key="ra_vus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rāvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for hravus, ghrav-us; root in Sanscr. gar-an; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/rwn,</foreign> senex; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">gh=ras, grau=s;</foreign> O. H. Germ. grā; Engl. gray</etym>, <sense id="n40490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gray-yellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tawny</hi> (rare but class.): ravi coloris appellantur, qui sunt inter flavos et caesios, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=272" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 272</bibl> Müll.. (mare illud) nobismet ipsis modo caeruleum videbatur, mane ravum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl> Goer. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (cited in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">fulix, id. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14 (al. cana): lupa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>. Said severai times of the eyes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:3" default="NO">9, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes ravi coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
re: <entryFree id="n40491" type="main" key="re^1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ</orth>, or with <sense id="n40491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">d</hi> demonstrative (see the letter D), <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕd</orth> (so, too, before vowels and <hi rend="ital">h;</hi> also in red-do, and with the union-vowel <hi rend="ital">i</hi> in rĕdĭ-vivus. In reicio and often in later Latin <hi rend="ital">re</hi> is found before vowels and <hi rend="ital">h;</hi> e. g. reaedifico, reexinanio, reinvito, etc. Assimilation of the <hi rend="ital">d</hi> before consonants produced the forms relligio, relliquiae, reccido; and the suppression of the <hi rend="ital">d</hi> may account for the frequent lengthening of the <hi rend="ital">e</hi> by poets in rēduco, rēlatum. The orthography and quantity of words compounded with <hi rend="ital">re</hi> are in general somewhat arbitrary, especially in the ante- and post-class. poets). An inseparable particle, whose fundamental signification answers to the Engl. <hi rend="ital">again</hi> and <hi rend="ital">against.</hi> Thus, it denotes either, </sense><sense id="n40491.1" n="a" level="4"> A turning back ward (Engl. back): recedo, recurro, reicio, remitto, resolvo, etc.; or, </sense><sense id="n40491.2" n="b" level="4"> An opposition: reboo, reclamo, redamo, reluctor, repugno; and, </sense><sense id="n40491.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40491.4" n="1" level="3"> A restoration of a thing to its original condition (e. g. a freeing or loosing from a state of constraint; Engl. re-, un-): redintegro, reficio, restituo, relaxo, relego, resero, recludo, resolvo, retego, etc.— </sense><sense id="n40491.5" n="2" level="3"> A transition into an opposite state: recharmido, reprobo (opp. comprobo), retracto, revelo.— </sense><sense id="n40491.6" n="3" level="3"> A repetition of an action: recoquo, resumo, reviso, etc.— </sense><sense id="n40491.7" n="4" level="3"> It is sometimes intensive, as redundo.</sense></entryFree>
rea: <entryFree id="n40492" type="main" key="re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. reus.</entryFree>
reaccendo: <entryFree id="n40493" type="main" key="re^accendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-accendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kindle anew</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 9, 30, v. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
readunatio: <entryFree id="n40494" type="hapax" key="re^adu_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-adūnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n40494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reuniting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reunion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossium (at the resurrection),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reaedifico: <entryFree id="n40495" type="main" key="re^aedi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-aedĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuild</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">reaedifico quae destruxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pud. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 15, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reagnosco: <entryFree id="n40496" type="main" key="re^agnosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕagnosco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to recall to mind</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reapse: <entryFree id="n40497" type="main" key="re_apse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēapse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from re and eapse, an old form for ipsā; hence in tmesi: reque eapse, Scip. Afr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=286:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 286, 3</bibl>; cf. ipse <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n40497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in reality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really</hi> (an old word, which does not occur after Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">reapse est re ipsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum ipsarum rerum reapse, non oratione perfectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reapse cerneretur, quale esset id, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obiciuntur etiam saepe formae, quae reapse nullae sunt, speciem autem offerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 37, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non perinde, ut est reapse, ex litteris perspicere potuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod idem reapse primum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reate: <entryFree id="n40498" type="main" key="Re^a_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕāte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (of the same form in the <case>nom.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, and <case>abl.</case>), <sense id="n40498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of the Sabines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rieti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:417" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 417</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n40498.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Reate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Reatine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini (which were highly valued),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rĕātīnĭ</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Reate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 8</bibl>, <pb n="1529" /> <cb n="REBO" /> 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45 al.</bibl> — <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod ego sum Reatinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
reatus: <entryFree id="n40499" type="main" key="re^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reus</etym>. <sense id="n40499.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the condition of an accused person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state of impeachment</hi> (a word first used by Messala, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">revocato ad reatum Alcibiade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si diutino tempore aliquis in reatu fuerit ... qui longo tempore in reatu agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 24, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40499.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40499.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An offence of which one stands accused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a charge</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 132, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40499.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The dress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appearance of an accused person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier reatu mirāque tristitie deformis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 231, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40499.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">guilt</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">reatus sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 21, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:32:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 32, 35</bibl>: praeteriit actu manet reatu, Aug. cont. Jul. Pelag. 6, 19, 60.</sense></entryFree>
rebaptizo: <entryFree id="n40500" type="main" key="re^bapti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-baptīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to baptize again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebaptize</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 203" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 203 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
rebellatio: <entryFree id="n40501" type="main" key="re^bella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rebello</etym>, <sense id="n40501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewal of hostilities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebellion</hi> (post-Aug. for the class. rebellio), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 7, 4, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rebellatrix: <entryFree id="n40502" type="main" key="re^bella_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbellātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that revolts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rebels</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Germania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rebellio: <entryFree id="n40503" type="main" key="re^belli^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewal of war</hi> (by the conquered party), <hi rend="ital">a revolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebellion</hi> (good prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defectio, seditio): rebellio facta post deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 38: parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rebellionem spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rebellionem compellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil rebellionis timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trium principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: multis Carthaginiensium rebellionibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 19, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40504" type="main" key="re^belli^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who revolts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an insurgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebel</hi> (late Lat.), Treb. Poll. Salon. 1; Faustina ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulc. Gall.</author> Avid. Cass. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 9</bibl>; cf. rebellis.</sense></entryFree>
rebellis: <entryFree id="n40505" type="main" key="re^bellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbellis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes war afresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insurgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebellious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n40505.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebelles Aeneadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 858</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio rebellis et indomita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 213</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbelles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rebels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40505.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellis amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae seditione rogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> And. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rebellium: <entryFree id="n40506" type="hapax" key="re^belli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewal of war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebellion</hi> (a collat. form for rebellio, like consortium for consortio, contagium for contagio, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui pacatos ad rebellium incitasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 21, 3</bibl></cit> Gronov. (dub.; Weissenb. rebellandum).</sense></entryFree>
rebello: <entryFree id="n40507" type="main" key="re^bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-bello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wage war again</hi> (said of the conquered), <hi rend="ital">to make an insurrection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebel</hi> (mostly postAug.; not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: descisco). </sense><sense id="n40507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volsci rebellarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 35</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 14, 5: crebrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl> (but very dub. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:44:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 44, 1</bibl>).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauro mutatus membra rebello,</quote> <trans><tr>renew the combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:619" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 619</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40507.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">credunt rebellare quae curaverint vitia,</quote> <trans><tr>to break out again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 109, § 174</bibl></cit>: rebellat saepe umor, <hi rend="ital">offers resistance</hi> (to writing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pudor rebellat,</quote> <trans><tr>resists</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 138" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille divus callidi monstri cinis in nos rebellat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sphinx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rebilus: <entryFree id="n40508" type="main" key="Rebilus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rebilus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surname of the legate</hi> C. Caninius, v. h. v.</sense></entryFree>
rebito: <entryFree id="n40509" type="main" key="re^bi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-bīto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bēto</etym>, <sense id="n40509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si non rebitas huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 49</bibl>; 3, 5, 89.</sense></entryFree>
reboatus: <entryFree id="n40510" type="main" key="re^bo^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕbŏātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>reboo</etym>, <sense id="n40510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shouting back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quidem omnes inter Musarum carmina concinentium audiri, licet perstreperent, nullo potuere reboatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 213</bibl></cit> (al. rabalatu).</sense></entryFree>
reboo: <entryFree id="n40511" type="main" key="re^bo^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-bŏo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40511.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bellow back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): reboant silvaeque et longus Olympus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 223</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rupti poli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17</bibl></cit>. 252: et reboat <cb n="RECA" /> raucum regio cita barbara bombum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 546</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reboatque ursa superba lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:634" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cymbalum sonat vox, ubi tympana reboant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40511.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make echo</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec citharis reboant laqueata aurataque templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reboat te quicquid carminis echo Respondet silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rebullio: <entryFree id="n40512" type="main" key="re^bulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-bullĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (Appuleian). </sense><sense id="n40512.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bubble up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 233, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40512.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to bubble forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast forth with a bubbling noise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 170, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <trans><tr>to breathe out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 108, 16.</sense></entryFree>
reburrus: <entryFree id="n40513" type="main" key="re^burrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕburrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n40513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with bristling hair</hi> (Fr. <hi rend="ital">rebours</hi>), Aug. c. Faust. 6, 1; Not. Tir.; <foreign lang="greek">a)na/sillos,</foreign> Thom. Thes.</sense></entryFree>
recalcitro: <entryFree id="n40514" type="hapax" key="re^calci^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-calcĭtro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kick back</hi> (of horses); transf. </sense><sense id="n40514.1" n="1" level="3"> (<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>) <hi rend="ital">To deny access</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40514.2" n="2" level="3"> (Late Lat.) <hi rend="ital">To be petulant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disobedient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incrassatus est dilectus, et recalcitravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">majestati Augustae recalcitrans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 11, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recalco: <entryFree id="n40515" type="main" key="re^calco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-calco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrace</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priora vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40515.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renew</hi>: mysteria, Cod. Th. 16, 6, 4.</sense></entryFree>
recalefacio: <entryFree id="n40516" type="main" key="re^ca^le^fa^cio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcălĕfăcio</orth>, v. recalfacio.</entryFree>
recaleo: <entryFree id="n40517" type="main" key="re^ca^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-călĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow warm again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be warm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): recalent nostro Tiberina fluenta Sanguine adhuc, <hi rend="ital">still run warm</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinctae recalent vestigia flammae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 8, 397</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40517.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recalebant in auribus ejus parentis effata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recalesco: <entryFree id="n40518" type="main" key="re^ca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-călesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become warm</hi> (<hi rend="ital">again</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to grow warm</hi> (rare but class.): cum motu atque exercitatione recalescunt (corpora), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40518.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens recalescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recalescere ex integro (in scribendo) et resumere impetum fractum omissumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recalfacio: <entryFree id="n40519" type="main" key="re^calfaci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-calfacĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕcălĕfacĭo</orth>), <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make warm</hi> (<hi rend="ital">again</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to warm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">calidumque priori Caede recalfecit consorti sanguine telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 443</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:698" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 214</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus recalfiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:63" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 63</bibl>.—Full form: <cit><quote lang="la">statim recalefacto corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40519.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidam recalface mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 445</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recalvaster: <entryFree id="n40520" type="main" key="re^calvaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcalvaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recalvus</etym>, <sense id="n40520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a bald forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bald in front</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 41</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 25</bibl>, the words quam recalvastrum are a gloss).</sense></entryFree>
recalvatio: <entryFree id="n40521" type="main" key="re^calva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcalvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">baldness in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bald forehead</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recalvus: <entryFree id="n40522" type="main" key="re^calvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-calvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (ante- and postclass.), <sense id="n40522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bald in front</hi>: frons, Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 38</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">with a bald forehead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
