recandesco: <entryFree id="n40523" type="main" key="re^candesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-candesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n40523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> (Ovidian). * </sense><sense id="n40523.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow white</hi> (<hi rend="ital">again</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">percussa recanduit unda,</quote> <trans><tr>grew white with foam</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 529</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40523.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow hot</hi> (<hi rend="ital">again</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tellus Solibus aetheriis ... recanduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rubuere genae, totoque recanduit ore (Medea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 78</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40523.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recanduit ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 707</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recano: <entryFree id="n40524" type="main" key="re^ca^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-căno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (Plinian). <sense id="n40524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sing back</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">call back by singing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illa (perdix) recanat revocetque (marem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus ... recanente lyrā fautor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 13</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n40524.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To charm back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undo a charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci etiam credunt serpentes ipsas recanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl></cit> (perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 21, § 69</bibl>, where Jan. reads praecanere. The form recĭno has another signif., v. recino).</sense></entryFree>
recanto: <entryFree id="n40525" type="main" key="re^canto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-canto</orth>, no <sense id="n40525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). * </sense><sense id="n40525.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam Graecula quod recantat Echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40525.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40525.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To repeat in singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius iste versiculus recantandus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40525.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recantatis opprobriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40525.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To charm back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla recantatas deponent pectora curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 259</bibl></cit>. <cb n="RECE" /></sense></entryFree>
recapitulatio: <entryFree id="n40526" type="main" key="re^ca^pi^tu^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcăpĭtŭlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recapitulo</etym>, <sense id="n40526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a summing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restatement by heads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recapitulation</hi> (late Lat. for repetitio, collectio): facta ex Adam, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
recapitulo: <entryFree id="n40527" type="main" key="re^ca^pi^tu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-căpĭtŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>capitulum</etym>, <sense id="n40527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go over the main points</hi> of a thing <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recapitulate;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nakefalaio/w</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 17</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 21 al.</sense></entryFree>
recaveo: <entryFree id="n40528" type="main" key="re^ca^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-căvĕo</orth>, <itype>cāvi, cautum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n40528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give counter-security</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 3, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcauta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quittance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">release</hi>, Novell. 130, 1.</sense></entryFree>
recavus: <entryFree id="n40529" type="main" key="re^ca^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-căvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n40529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arched inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concave</hi> (late Lat.): speculum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef,</foreign> 11, 186: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psych. 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laquearia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 28, 408</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recedo: <entryFree id="n40530" type="main" key="re^ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n40530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recede.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40530.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decedo, abscedo): pone nos recede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego abs te procul recedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recedere loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones ex eo quo stabant loco recesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo illum e Galliā non discessisse, sed ne a Mutinā quidem recessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul a telo veniente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:151" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis recedo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 19, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Illiturgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra Corneliana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n40530.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi> to one's bedchamber, <hi rend="ital">go to rest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:239" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 239</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40530.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40530.4" n="1" level="3"> Of inanimate and abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illae undae ad alios accedant, ab aliis autem recedant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba movere loco, quamvis invita recedant,</quote> <trans><tr>yield</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ferunt anni venientes commoda secum, Multa recedentes adimunt,</quote> <trans><tr>the departing years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeant ac recedant voces illae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40530.5" n="2" level="3"> Of places, things, etc., <hi rend="ital">to stand back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recede</hi> (i. e. to be distant or retired; <cit><quote lang="la">freq., esp. after the Aug. per.): secreta parentis Anchisae domus arboribusque obtecta recessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 300</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 43</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi lata recessit Urbe domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:242" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 242</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palaestina vocabatur, quā contingit Arabas ... et quā recedit intus, Damascena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magna Graecia in tres sinus recedens Ausonii maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18</bibl>.—Of nations: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Cappadocum longissime Ponticarum omnium introrsus recedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 8, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>.—In a painting, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor vi artis suae efficit, ut quaedam eminere in opere, quaedam recessisse credamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venter recessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of places, which appear <hi rend="ital">to recede</hi> by our departure from them: <cit><quote lang="la">provehimur portu, terraeque urbesque recedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea terra recedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 466</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:157" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:549 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 549 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n40530.6" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi> from a place, <hi rend="ital">to abandon</hi> a thing, = discedere. </sense><sense id="n40530.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (in good prose very rare), = discedere, haec effatu' pater, germana, repente recessit, <hi rend="ital">vanished</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 48 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero a stabulis pluviā impendente recedunt Longius (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40530.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi> from any thing (with which it was previously connected): <cit><quote lang="la">in aliis ossibus ex toto saepe fragmentum a fragmento recedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes ab ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:67" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 23, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput e cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: caput cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 153</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:708" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 674</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n40530.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desist</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic. and Quint.): si quid vos per laborem recte feceritis, labor ille a vobis cito recedet, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avius a verā longe ratione recedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes, ut in otia tuta recedant, aiunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab officio recedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 20, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab armis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lay them down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus a naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eodem exemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO">2, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:21" default="NO">7, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sententiis ejus, ab omni voluntate, consiliisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: a vitā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kill one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 40</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 6</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>, in gen., a doubtful conjecture; Jahn, procedente <pb n="1530" /> <cb n="RECE" /> vitā): <cit><quote lang="la">a veritatis viā longe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppugnatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40</bibl></cit>.—Very freq. of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam recessit vita patrio corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nomen hostis) a peregrino recessit et proprie in eo, qui arma contra ferret, remansit,</quote> <trans><tr>has lost the signification of foreigner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res a consuetudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 21, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae sententiarum ab illo simplici modo indicandi recedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab usu cotidiano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 44</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic nunquam corde recedit Nata tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>departs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pariter Phoebes, pariter maris ira recessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quonam nostri tibi cura recessit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna recessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ventos vita recessit,</quote> <trans><tr>passed away into the winds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 705</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">drawn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaena recessior,</quote> <trans><tr>standing farther back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recello: <entryFree id="n40531" type="main" key="re^cello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cello</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40531.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recellere reclinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=274" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 274</bibl></cit> Müll. (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. examples): (terra) inclinatur retroque recellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (ferrea manus) gravi libramento plumbi recelleret ad solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 10</bibl></cit>, v. Weissenb. ad h. l.— </sense><sense id="n40531.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bend back</hi> (Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">totum corporis pondus in postremos poplites recello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 198, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 249, 19.</sense></entryFree>
recens: <entryFree id="n40532" type="main" key="re^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<sense id="n40532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, regularly, recenti; but in the poets sometimes recente, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:346 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 346 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>, regularly, recentium: <cit><quote lang="la">recentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 601</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>re and cand-; cf.: candeo, candor; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kaino/s, kai/w</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">that has not long existed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recent</hi> (opp. vetus, and differing from novus; v. antiquus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod si veteris contumeliae oblivisci vellet: num etiam recentium injuriarum memoriam deponere posse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verres) cum e provinciā recens esset invidiāque et infamiā non recenti sed vetere ac diuturnā flagraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regini quidam eo venerunt, Romā sane recentes,</quote> <trans><tr>directly from Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis conglutinatio recens aegre, inveterata facile divellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hanc ipsam recentem novam devoravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(piscis) nequam est, nisi recens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli,</quote> <trans><tr>just whelped</tr>, <tr>young</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsae (oves),</quote> <trans><tr>newly shorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caespites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:346" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 346</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <trans><tr>fresh</tr>, <tr>green</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 674</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans><tr>newly shed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 7</bibl></cit>: sol, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the rising sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the east</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:54" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 47: clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22, 4</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans><tr>fresh</tr>, <tr>newly whetted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>of those newly deceased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:434" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:488" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 488</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:846" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 846</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: non erit in te Deus recens, <hi rend="ital">newly devised</hi>, and hence <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:80:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 80, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula recentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentiore memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ex amicis recentioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentissima tua est epistula Kal. data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentissima quaeque sunt correcta et emendata maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1</bibl></cit>. 4, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">Senones recentissimi advenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40532.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly after</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pullum asininum a partu recentem subiciunt equae,</quote> <trans><tr>newly foaled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus, qui recens ab illorum aetate fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens a vulnere Dido,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with her wound still fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenum recentem ab excidio opulentissimae urbis Iberum transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alti spiritus viros, ut ita dicam, a diis recentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:44" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vox, a quā recens sum: sonat adhuc et vibrat in auribus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40532.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or (more freq.) with simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alio recentior sit in dolore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod comitatum Agrippinae longo maerore fessum obvii et recentes in dolore anteibant,</quote> <trans><tr>yet fresh in grief</tr>, <tr>whose grief was still fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quaedam (verba)<cb n="RECE" />  in usu perquam recentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut erat recens dolore et irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">recens praeturā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 15, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40532.3" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentes sumus ad id quod incipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40532.4" n="b" level="4"> Recenti re, <hi rend="ital">while the matter is fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si recenti re aedes pultem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53, § 139</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, recenti negotio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>, § 101; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40532.5" n="c" level="4"> Recentiores (<hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> and <pos>adj.</pos>), <hi rend="ital">the moderns</hi> (said of authors): <cit><quote lang="la">attulisti aliud humanius horum recentiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>modern writers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 74</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci recentiores,</quote> <trans><tr>modern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40532.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi> in strength, <hi rend="ital">not exhausted by fatigue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut integri et recentes defatigatis succederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">integer et recens (opp.: fusus et saucius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the order: recentes atque integri (opp. defatigati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, opp. defessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens animus (consulis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 34</bibl></cit> (along with integrae vires); 38, 25 (opp. fessi); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: sauciis ac defatigatis integros recentioribusque viribus subministrare, Auct. B. Afr. 78, 6. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: recens and recenter, <hi rend="ital">lately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">newly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recently</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n40532.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcens</orth> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">puerum recens natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captum hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaena perfusa croco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinctum lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria recens detracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">inter recens domitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: portentum conflatum est recens, Bass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluae recens captae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptum vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdomita Hispania,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 69</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">condita Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40532.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcen-ter</orth> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capti turdi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecta poma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40532.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam recentissime stercorato solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 192</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res gestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recenseo: <entryFree id="n40533" type="main" key="re^cense^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-censĕo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sum, and sītum</itype> (recensus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl>, acc. to the better read., recensitus; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1069</bibl>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n40533.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enumerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi> (syn.: numero; class., but not in Cic.; see, however, recensio): haec in Aeduorum finibus recensebantur numerusque inibatur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recensuit captivos, quot cujusque populi essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem suorum numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos ordine pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 932</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo acceptam cladem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus et familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et recensuit Saul populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 13, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40533.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">review</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi> (mostly post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestem servitiorum et ferramenta, bis singulis mensibus (along with recognitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca ab initio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera ad numerum pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: qui recensi (recensiti) non essent, <hi rend="ital">who had not been received</hi> or <hi rend="ital">considered</hi> (in the distribution of the public corn), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Esp., of troops, etc., <hi rend="ital">to review</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in recensendo exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 16</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa recensuerat bis sol sua,</quote> <trans><tr>had gone through</tr>, <tr>run through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:575" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40533.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> in thought, in narration, or in critical treatment, <hi rend="ital">to reckon up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">review</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fata fortunasque virūm moresque manusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortia facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 105</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deploratos Priamidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec recensente pictore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut post recenserentur (poemata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod magnificum referente alio fuisset, ipso qui gesserat recensente vanescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recensio: <entryFree id="n40534" type="main" key="re^censi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recenseo</etym>, <sense id="n40534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enumeration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recension</hi> (very rare): qui aedem Nympharum incendit, ut memoriam publicam recensionis tabulis publicis impressam exstingueret, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the censor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s register</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">census populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>): ne <cb n="RECE" /> qui novi coetus recensionis causā moveri quandoque possent, <hi rend="ital">on account of the new enumeration</hi> (for the distribution of the public corn), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
recensitio: <entryFree id="n40535" type="hapax" key="re^censi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcensītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recenseo</etym>, <sense id="n40535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mustering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enumeration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:3:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recensitus: <entryFree id="n40536" type="main" key="re^censi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcensītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. recenseo.</entryFree>
recensus: <entryFree id="n40537" type="main" key="re^census1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. recenseo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40538" type="main" key="re^census2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recenseo</etym>, <sense id="n40538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enumeration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a review</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">populi (for the distribution of the public corn),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 115</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recentarius: <entryFree id="n40539" type="gloss" key="re^centa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recens</etym>, <sense id="n40539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vender of wine which has been cooled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made fresh</hi>, Inscr. ap. Labus. Monum. Epigr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> p. 35</bibl>, n. 8.— In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcentā-rĭa</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">nearofo/ros,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
recenter: <entryFree id="n40540" type="main" key="re^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. recens <sense id="n40540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
recentor: <entryFree id="n40541" type="hapax" key="re^centor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcentor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>recens</etym>, <sense id="n40541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to renew itself</hi>, a word formed by Cn. Matius: recentatur Commune lumen hominibus, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:25:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 25, 1</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recentoricusager: <entryFree id="n40542" type="main" key="Recentoricus a^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Recentoricus ăger</orth>, <sense id="n40542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Roman public lands in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 57</bibl> (Zumpt, censorius).</sense></entryFree>
receptabilis: <entryFree id="n40543" type="main" key="re^cepta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recepto</etym>, <sense id="n40543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">susceptible of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capable of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">passionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 44, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
receptaculum: <entryFree id="n40544" type="main" key="re^cepta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, a place to receive or keep things in, <sense id="n40544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reservoir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magazine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receptacle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40544.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus quasi vas est aut aliquod animi receptaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi et potionis (alvus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi receptaculum ventriculus, Lact. Opif. Dei, 11: avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatilium animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cloaca maxima, receptaculum omnium purgamentorum urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>a reservoir</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 27, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40544.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a place of refuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lurking-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, = locus ad receptum aptus (so usually): <cit><quote lang="la">castra sunt victori receptaculum, victo perfugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sicilia) illud receptaculum classibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro castello ac receptaculo turrim facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">castella diruit, ne receptaculo hostibus essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua receptaculum aratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitiis ex Achaiā fugientibus receptacula Macedonia erat,</quote> <trans><tr>a rendezvous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 11</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud tibi oppidum receptaculum praedae fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>a hiding-place for booty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:23:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptaculum adversae pugnae,</quote> <trans><tr>a place of refuge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptaculum fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with which cf. exsulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptaculum habuere castra sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:2" default="NO">9, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices spinā et frutice sic muniunt receptaculum,</quote> <trans><tr>their nest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mors) aeternum nihil sentiendi receptaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
receptatio: <entryFree id="n40545" type="hapax" key="re^cepta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receiving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taking again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
receptator: <entryFree id="n40546" type="main" key="re^cepta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelterer;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a hider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Rhenus) receptator hostium atque defensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de receptatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO">1, 15, 3</bibl>; cf. receptor.</sense></entryFree>
receptibilis: <entryFree id="n40547" type="main" key="re^cepti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recipio</etym>, <sense id="n40547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be acquired again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recoverable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra scientia amissibilis est et receptibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 15:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 15, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recepticius: <entryFree id="n40548" type="main" key="re^cepti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>recipio, I. A. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n40548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kept back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserved</hi>: servus, <hi rend="ital">one whom the wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the delivery of the</hi> dos, <hi rend="ital">retains as her own exclusive property</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6, 5</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">dos, quam quis in mortem mulieris a marito stipulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:6:31:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 6, 31, § 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <trans><tr>a complaint to secure the payment of a debt from a surety</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
receptio: <entryFree id="n40549" type="main" key="re^cepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recipio</etym>. <sense id="n40549.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A receiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi huc receptio ad te est meum virum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit> (cf., for the construction, accessio, aditio, curatio, tactio, etc.).—Esp., </sense><sense id="n40549.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A secret reception</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">David,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40549.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A holding back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relaining;</hi><pb n="1531" /> <cb n="RECE" />  esp. jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">reservation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid venditor recipere vult, nominatim recipi oportet: nam illa generalis receptio nihil prospicit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recepto: <entryFree id="n40550" type="main" key="re^cepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>recipio</etym>, <sense id="n40550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive back; to recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retake</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.): quae cava corpore caeruleo cortina receptat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 48</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 9 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1001" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1001</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placido natura receptat Cuncta sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 810</bibl></cit>: corpus omnes Paulatim redit in sensus animamque receptat, <hi rend="ital">and takes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receives back again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 505</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">To receive habitually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, etc.: meum receptas filium ad te Pamphilum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you receive my son</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s visits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatores,</quote> <trans><tr>to receive</tr>, <tr>admit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam receptat Ossibus haerentem,</quote> <trans><tr>tugs back the spear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 383</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> anywhere, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recede</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in tectum te receptes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni sese quo stella receptet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, quā multā litus se valle receptat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
receptor: <entryFree id="n40551" type="main" key="re^ceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n40551.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A receiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelterer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <trans><tr>who releases from servitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 144</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40551.1" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a hider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantum qui rapiunt, verum is quoque, qui recipit ex causis supra scriptis tenetur, quia receptores non minus delinquunt quam aggressores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:9:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 9, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">furum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: ipse ille latronum occultator et receptor locus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedarum receptor et socius populandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abigeorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:14:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40551.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n40551.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reconqueror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orientis occidentisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
receptorius: <entryFree id="n40552" type="main" key="re^cepto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for receiving</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place of shelter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
receptrix: <entryFree id="n40553" type="main" key="re^ceptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>receptor</etym>. <sense id="n40553.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She that receives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 66, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Asclep. p. 77, 30</bibl>; p. 287 Bip.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n40553.1" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">she that harbors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conceals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messana, praedarum ac furtorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 62, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
receptum: <entryFree id="n40554" type="main" key="re^ceptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. recipio <sense id="n40554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
receptus: <entryFree id="n40555" type="main" key="re^ceptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. recipio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40556" type="main" key="re^ceptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recipio</etym>. <sense id="n40556.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drawing back</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n40556.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus ... in receptu difficilis,</quote> <trans><tr>hard to recover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32:section=53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32, § 53</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40556.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a retraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recantation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus nimis pertinacis sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40556.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falling back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a retiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">ut expeditum ad suos receptum habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">habere receptum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply receptus habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 59</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 39 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum receptus primis non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare receptum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 82</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply receptus dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar receptui cani jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui signum audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum dare receptui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar receptui suorum timens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui sibi consulebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">4: haud facili inde receptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 7</bibl></cit>: ne receptum amittam, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C, 2 et saep.: canere receptui a miseriis contemplandis, <hi rend="ital">to give the signal for leaving off</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 33</bibl>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bucina) cecinit jussos inflata receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cane, Musa, receptus,</quote> <trans><tr>leave off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 31</bibl></cit>; and in the signif., <hi rend="ital">place of retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuti recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices surculis receptus suos vestiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>nests</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. receptaculum, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).— </sense><sense id="n40556.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus et recursus maris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ebb and flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Paneg. Const. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n40556.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a retiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falling back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui canente receptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus ad Caesaris gratiam atque amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptum ad poenitendum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad expertam clementiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a malis consiliis receptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl>. 23, 2. <cb n="RECI" /></sense></entryFree>
recessim: <entryFree id="n40557" type="main" key="re^cessim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcessim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>recedo</etym>, <sense id="n40557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedam, imitabor nepam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunas recessim rursum vorsum trahere et ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recessio: <entryFree id="n40558" type="hapax" key="re^cessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recession</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recessus: <entryFree id="n40559" type="main" key="re^cessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. recedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40560" type="main" key="re^cessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recedo</etym>, <sense id="n40560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure;</hi> opp. accessus (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">receptus): accessus ad res salutares, a pestiferis recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut luna accessu et recessu suo lumen accipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl></cit>.— Of the <hi rend="ital">ebb</hi> of the tide: <cit><quote lang="la">quid de fretis aut de marinis aestibus plura dicam? quorum accessus et recessus lunae motu gubernantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl>: recessum primis ultimi non dabant, i. e. <hi rend="ital">means of retreat</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <trans><tr>its removal from the eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 88</bibl></cit>: cum processui et recessui cani juberet, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in going home</hi>, Treb. Gall. 17, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40560.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">a distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retired</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">secret spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a nook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recess</hi> (acc. to recedo, I. B. 2.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: secessus, secretum): mihi solitudo et recessus provincia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos terrarum ac libertatis extremos recessus ipse ac sinus famae in hunc diem defendit,</quote> <trans><tr>our remote position itself and our distant renown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, sicut aestivas aves, statim auctumno tecta ac recessum circumspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vox quasi in recessu oris auditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic spelunca fuit, vasto submota recessu,</quote> <trans><tr>in a deep recess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 193</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 691</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 592</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi marmoreo Superi sedere recessu,</quote> <trans><tr>in the marble hall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi in recessu cavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45</bibl> (along with anguli); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 670</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 902</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:555" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 555</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n40560.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum accessus a te ad causam facti, tum recessus,</quote> <trans><tr>advances and retreats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat illa in dicendo admiratio ac summa laus umbram aliquam et recessum, quo magis id, quod erit illuminatum, extare atque eminere videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat of shade and background</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec professio plus habet in recessu quam fronte promittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita hominum altos recessus magnasque latebras habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis hominum tantae latebrae sunt et tanti recessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenua ingenia, quo plus recessus sumunt,</quote> <trans><tr>leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
