rechamus: <entryFree id="n40561" type="hapax" key="rechamus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rechamus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> In mechanics, like trochlea, <sense id="n40561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a block</hi> or <hi rend="ital">case containing a set of pulleys</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2, 1</bibl>, and 2.</sense></entryFree>
recharmido: <entryFree id="n40562" type="main" key="re^charmi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcharmĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>re and Charmides, a character in Plautus; cf. re, II. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n40562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cease to be Charmides</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">to decharmidize one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, a burlesquely formed word: proin tu te itidem, ut Charmidatus es, rursum te recharmida, <hi rend="ital">as you have been Charmidized</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recharmidize yourself</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">as you have put on the character of Charmides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay it aside again</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 135</bibl> (Ritschl, decharmida).</sense></entryFree>
recidivatus: <entryFree id="n40563" type="main" key="re^ci^di_va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭdīvātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>recidivus</etym>, <sense id="n40563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi> (Tertullian): <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recidivus: <entryFree id="n40564" type="main" key="re^ci^di_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭdīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. recido</etym>, <sense id="n40564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">falling back</hi>, i. e. trop., <hi rend="ital">returning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recurring</hi> (rare, and not ante-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">redivivus): febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:363" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergama,</quote> <trans><tr>restored</tr>, <tr>rebuilt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 344</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 322</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 58</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated in gens Phrygum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:106" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 257</bibl></cit> (al. rediviva).</sense></entryFree>
recido: <entryFree id="n40565" type="main" key="re^ci^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭdo</orth>, <itype>reccidi</itype> (better than recidi; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl>), cāsum (recasurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:127" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 127</bibl>), 3 (with <sense id="n40565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">e</hi> long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 857</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1063" default="NO" valid="yes">1063</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:280" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 280</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">180</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 15 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">prob., also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit>, and Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 39; v. the art. re), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to fall back</hi> (class., and very freq., esp. in the trop. signif.; but not found in Virg. or Hor.). </sense><sense id="n40565.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: neque posse e terris in loca caeli Recidere inferiora,<cb n="RECI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1063</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia et recidant omnia in terras et oriantur e terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramulum adductum, ut remissus esset, in oculum suum reccidisse,</quote> <trans><tr>had sprung back</tr>, <tr>recoiled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (discum) libratum in auras Misit ... Recidit in solidam longo post tempore terram Pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si recta recciderat (navis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 44 et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in collum Benjamin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:45:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 45, 14</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictum recidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:162" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 162</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40565.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in graviorem morbum recidere,</quote> <trans><tr>to relapse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so alone: ab his me remediis noli in istam turbam vocare, ne recidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(quartanae) ne recidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 66, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post interitum Tatii cum ad eum (sc. Romulum) potentatus omnis reccidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestat in eandem illam recidere fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 146</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusae in antiquam servitutem recciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe celebratam Macedonum fortitudinem ad ludibrium reccidisse verebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—So freq. of an evil, <hi rend="ital">to fall back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recoil</hi> upon any one, esp. upon the author of it: omnes in te istaec recident contumeliae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hujus amentiae poena in ipsum familiamque ejus recidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem in vosmet ipsos recidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl></cit>: hunc casum ad ipsos recidere posse demonstrant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in adversarios recidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in ipsam recidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia in ipsorum caput recidentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosa et adversa cuncta in illos recasura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in me haec omnia mala recciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:42:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 42, 36</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n40565.3" n="II" level="1"> (With the idea of cadere predominating.) <hi rend="ital">To fall</hi> somewhere, <hi rend="ital">to light upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>, = redigi; constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or an <hi rend="ital">adv. of direction.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40565.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex laetitiā et voluptate ad ludum et lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: ex liberatore patriae ad Aquilios se Vitelliosque reccidisse, <hi rend="ital">had sunk to a level with the Aquilii and Vitellii</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had come to be regarded as a traitor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl>: sinere artem musicam Recidere ad paucos, <hi rend="ital">to fall into the possession of a few</hi>, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 39: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum apparatum ad nihilum recidere,</quote> <trans><tr>to come to naught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 857</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:233" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40565.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (tela), si viginti quiessem dies, in aliorum vigiliam consulum reccidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ut in eam fortunam recideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis impensa in cassum recidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi, In quem reccidimus, quidquid mortale creamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40565.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">adv. of direction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huccine tandem omnia recciderunt, ut civis Romanus ... in foro virgis caederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo regiae majestatis imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quantis opibus quo reccidissent Carthaginiensium res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque, quo debuerint, reccidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum responsum recidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n40566" type="main" key="re^ci_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cīdo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caedo</etym>, <sense id="n40566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n40566.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vepres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolos ad imum articulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum imo de stirpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 208</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: laurum imā stirpe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 76</bibl></cit> (cf. II.): <cit><quote lang="la">ceras inanes,</quote> <trans><tr>empty cells</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirsutam barbam falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immedicabile vulnus Ense recidendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:32:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 35, 52, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas,</quote> <trans><tr>to hew out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fustes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancile ab omni parte recisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:377" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to take out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of persons: cuncti simul ense recisi,</quote> <trans><tr>cut down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 194</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgorem sideribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to rob the stars of their brightness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:310" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina morsu,</quote> <trans><tr>to devour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:45" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40566.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (borrowed from agriculture), <hi rend="ital">to lop off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam multa recidam ex orationibus Ciceronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanem loquacitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: ambitiosa<pb n="1532" /> <cb n="RECI" />  ornamenta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 447</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne quod ultra Perfectum traheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 69</bibl></cit>: nationes partim recisas, partim repressas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedes scaenicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armaturas mirmillonum,</quote> <trans><tr>to lessen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornandi potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem aliter acquirendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>to diminish</tr>, <tr>obviate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">occupationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam supplicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnis parva mineris Falce recisurum simili te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 123</bibl></cit>: vitia a stirpe, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 56</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid priscum ad morem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to reduce within the limits of ancient manners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridged; short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea recisa in unum librum coartasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus recisius (opp. longius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:21:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
recinctus: <entryFree id="n40567" type="main" key="re^cinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from recingo.</entryFree>
recingo: <entryFree id="n40568" type="main" key="re^cingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cingo</orth>, no <sense id="n40568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to ungird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi> that which was girded (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word of the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Ov.): tunicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 398</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 182</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 518</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veste recinctā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:115" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 116</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: neque eo contenta recingor,</quote> <trans><tr>I ungird myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 593</bibl></cit>; and, in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> construction, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum recingitur anguem,</quote> <trans><tr>divests herself of the snake which she had girt around her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 510</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum recingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:75" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 75</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier recincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 266</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40568.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gird again</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Serenianus recinctus est ut Pannonius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recinium: <entryFree id="n40569" type="main" key="re_ci_nium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rēcīnium</orth>, v. ricinium.</entryFree>
recino: <entryFree id="n40570" type="main" key="re^ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cĭno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n40570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cano]. </sense><sense id="n40570.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sing again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">re-echo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">echo forth</hi> (rare): quod in vocibus nostrorum oratorum recinit quiddam et resonat urbanius, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus recinet jocosa Nomen imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40570.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cause to resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parrae recinentis omen,</quote> <trans><tr>noisy</tr>, <tr>screeching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec recinunt juvenes dictata senesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu curvā recines lyrā Latonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 28, 11</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n40570.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 2, p. 52, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reciperatio: <entryFree id="n40571" type="main" key="re^ci^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭpĕrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>recipero</etym>. <sense id="n40571.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A getting back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recovery</hi>: libertatis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 20</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">urbium, quas amiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marcidus egens reciperatione,</quote> <trans><tr>restoration of health</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 13, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40571.1" n="II" level="1"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a judicial decision of the</hi> recuperatores; v. reciperator, II.</sense></entryFree>
reciperativus: <entryFree id="n40572" type="hapax" key="re^ci^pe^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭpĕrātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be regained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recoverable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> p. 63</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
reciperator: <entryFree id="n40573" type="main" key="re^ci^pe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭpĕrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n40573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a regainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recoverer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40573.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>a recapturer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diviti decepto multi recuperatores,</quote> <trans><tr>helpers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 13, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40573.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., jurid. t. t., recuperatores, <hi rend="ital">a board consisting of three</hi> or <hi rend="ital">five members</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally only for processes between Romans and</hi> peregrini, <hi rend="ital">but afterwards for summary trial in other causes</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">concerning property and</hi> de statu (cf.: arbiter, judex; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:46" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:109" default="NO">109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:185" default="NO">185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam praetor reciperatores dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 58, § 135</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:13 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 13 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
reciperatorius: <entryFree id="n40574" type="main" key="re^ci^pe^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭpĕrātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reciperator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n40574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> reciperatores: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:105" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
recipero: <entryFree id="n40575" type="main" key="re^ci^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cĭpĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rĕcŭp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>, <sense id="n40575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obtain again; to regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>, etc. (good prose; cf.: reparo, redimo). </sense><sense id="n40575.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui erepta recuperare vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suum, pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas patrias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternas opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, ordinem militandi, locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 13, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 141</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 89</bibl></cit> <cb n="RECI" /> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albanum, Formianum a Dolabellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam depositam ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos nostros a Carthaginiensibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to retake</tr>, <tr>recover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 109</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With an abstr. object: veterem belli gloriam libertatemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pristinam belli laudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires cibo somnoque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia (equites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum togae,</quote> <trans><tr>to resume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40575.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40575.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To obtain again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si et vos et me ipsum reciperaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum per te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulos,</quote> <trans><tr>to gain over again</tr>, <tr>regain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se quiete reciperare,</quote> <trans><tr>to recruit</tr>, <tr>recover themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so mid.: radices arborum reciperantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40575.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To revive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">crede Deo et reciperabit te,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
recipie: <entryFree id="n40576" type="main" key="re^ci^pi^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕcĭpĭe</orth>, v. recipio <sense id="n40576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
recipio: <entryFree id="n40577" type="main" key="re^ci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕ-cĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n40577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. apoc.</hi> recipie, for recipiam, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=138" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 138</bibl> and 236 Müll.; v. dico <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recepso, for recepero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 19</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n40577.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring back; to retake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40577.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dandis recipiendisque meritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu me sequere ad trapezitam . . . recipe actutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 49</bibl></cit> (just before, ni argentum refers); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">centum talenta et credidisse eos constat, et non recepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl></cit>; and (opp. mutuum dare) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:40:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 40, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si velit suos recipere, obsides sibi remittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recepto amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 47</bibl>. — Freq. of places, etc., once captured and lost, <hi rend="ital">to retake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Tarento amisso ... aliquot post annos Maximus id oppidum recepisset ... nunquam ego (Tarentum) recepissem, nisi tu perdidisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 273</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lavinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of other things: recipere suas res amissas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda omnis recepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa, quae ademerant Parthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl>: pectore in adverso totum cui comminus ensem Condidit assurgenti, et multā morte recepit, <hi rend="ital">drew out again</hi>, = retraxit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 348</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sagittam ab alterā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: suos omnes incolumes receperunt (sc. ex oppido in castra), <hi rend="ital">drew off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdrew</hi>, = reduxerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">milites defessos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum navibus ad se intra munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ego ... medio ex hoste recepi,</quote> <trans><tr>bore away</tr>, <tr>rescued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 111</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40577.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi> from or to any place, <hi rend="ital">to betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> anywhere; in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se e fano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex hisce locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se e Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">recipe te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl></cit> (just before, reverti); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl> (coupled with loco excedere); 3, 46; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sui recipiendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 37</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: se recipiendi spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipe te ad erum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad dominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 52</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad Caesarem (Allobroges, legati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad agmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se penitus ad extremos fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad legionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 50</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad oppidum llerdam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad ordines suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a pabulo ad stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde se in currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex castris in oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2</bibl></cit>. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 2, 24; 3, 6; 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 15 et saep.: se in fines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in Galliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in montem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: se <cb n="RECI" /> in antiquas munitiones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in silvas ad suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in castra ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se retro in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: sese retro in Bruttios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so, se, with rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in novissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se intra munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se intra montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se per declive,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sub murum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se trans Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Larissam versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se domum ex hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Adrumetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Hispalim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Dyrrhachium ad Pompeium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 23 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se huc esum ad praesepim suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit> et saep. — In the same meaning, without <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: neque sepulcrum, quo recipiat, habeat portum corporis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 415 Vahl.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a military retreat: si quo erat longius prodeundum aut celerius recipiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so without <hi rend="ital">se</hi> after the <hi rend="ital">verbum finitum</hi> several times in Plaut.: <cit><quote lang="la">rursum in portum recipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum recipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actutum face recipias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40577.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40577.5" n="(a)" level="5"> In business lang., <hi rend="ital">to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6, 6</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">posticulum hoc recepit, quom aedis vendidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 157</bibl></cit>; so in a sale, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 26, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:10" default="NO">8, 4, 10</bibl>: mulier magnam dotem dat et magnam pecuniam recipit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6, 8</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149, 2</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua, itinere, actu domini usioni recipitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40577.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To restore</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbem munitissimam,</quote> <trans><tr>to fortify anew</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 3, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40577.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to get back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring back; to receive again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut antiquam frequentiam recipere vastam ac desertam bellis urbem paterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et totidem, quot dixit, verba recepit,</quote> <trans><tr>got back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (vitam) postquam recepi,</quote> <trans><tr>received again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:535" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 535</bibl></cit>: anhelitum, <hi rend="ital">to recover one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s breath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 16</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">13: a tanto pavore recipere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 16</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">a pavore animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e pavore recepto animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: animos ex pavore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recepto animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:29" default="NO">9, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum vultumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:615" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente receptā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vocem) ab acutissimo sono usque ad gravissimum sonum recipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring it back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In zeugma (cf. I. A. supra): arma et animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n40577.8" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">se.</hi> </sense><sense id="n40577.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi> from or to any place: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ingenium vetus versutum te recipis tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad frugem bonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad reliquam cogitationem belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a voluptatibus in otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in principem,</quote> <trans><tr>to resume his princely air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 76:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 5</bibl></cit>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n40577.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To recover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficulter se recipiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>regain strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum intuerer stupens, ut me recepi, Quis hic, inquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum spatium respirandi recipiendique se dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex terrore ac fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex timore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex fugā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum totā me mente recepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n40577.11" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to re, I. b.) <hi rend="ital">To take to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive;</hi> constr. with the simple <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, with simple <case>abl.</case>, with a local <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n40577.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40577.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos homines quondam Laurentis terra recepit, Enn. ap. Prisc. p 762 P. (Ann. v. 35 Vahl.): (ego) excludor, ille recipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic nulla munitio est, quae perterritos recipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos tutissimus portus recipiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 35: eum Jugurtha accuratissime recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quisquam aut expulsus invidiosius aut receptus est laetius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:89" default="NO">9, 2, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi nos vicina Trivici Villa recepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 80</bibl></cit> <pb n="1533" /> <cb n="RECI" /> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisnam istic fluvius est, quem non recipiat mare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">(Peneus) accipit amnem Orcon nec recipit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>does not take it to itself</tr>, <tr>does not mingle with it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus frenum recepit,</quote> <trans><tr>received</tr>, <tr>submitted to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse erat, ab latere aperto tela recipi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40577.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipe me ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad lusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40577.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipe me in tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubinam in aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in custodiam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinium in civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in ordinem senatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 14 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in jus dicionemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 4</bibl> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 5, 9</bibl> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n40577.16" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (rare and in purely local relations; v. Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricati in equis recipiuntur, Auct. B. Hisp. 4, 2: sidera in caelo recepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 529</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 32, 6</bibl>, the correct read. is tuto Hexapylo, without in; v. Weissenb. ad h. l.). — (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With simple <case>abl.</case> (mostly in purely local relations): <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuo recipias tecto servesque nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum tectis ac sedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suis urbibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem finibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem oppido ac portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 102</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus caelo receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus Terra Neptunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 63</bibl></cit> et saep. — (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With local <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Acheruntem recipere Orcus noluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem domum suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem domum ad se hospitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerosque hi, qui receperant, celant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40577.17" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40577.18" n="a" level="4"> In business lang., <hi rend="ital">to take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi> as the proceeds of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">dena milia sestertia ex melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex novis vectigalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia, quae recipi potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40577.19" n="b" level="4"> In gladiator's lang.: recipe ferrum, <hi rend="ital">receive your death-blow</hi>, the cry of the people to a vanquished gladiator whom they were not inclined to spare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl> Kühn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: totum telum corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ense recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 194</bibl></cit> Corte.— </sense><sense id="n40577.20" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>: mittit in Siciliam Curionem pro praetore cum legionibus duo; <cit><quote lang="la">eundem, cum Siciliam recepisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praeneste non vi, sed per deditionem receptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptum sine certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo oppido recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8</bibl></cit>; 7, 90; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 16: Aetoliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alciden terra recepta vocat,</quote> <trans><tr>the subjugated earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:9:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 9, 38</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n40577.21" n="d" level="4"> In the later medical lang., of medicines, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be compounded of</hi> various ingredients: <cit><quote lang="la">antidotos recipit haec: stoechados, marrubii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 106" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 106</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl>; 28; 37; 52 al. (hence the mod. Lat. receptum, <hi rend="ital">receipt</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">recipe</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n40577.22" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n40577.23" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assume; to receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)nde/xomai</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">non edepol istaec tua dicta nunc in aures recipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 24</bibl>: in semet ipsum religionem recipere, <hi rend="ital">to draw upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae legibus cauta sunt, quae persuasione in mores recepta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>admitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitas recepit fabulas . . . haec aetas autem respuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec inconstantiam virtus recipit nec varietatem natura patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>;
