cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 3</bibl>: non recipit istam Conjunctionem honestas, Cic. Off. <cb n="RECI" /> 3, 33, 119: <cit><quote lang="la">assentatio nocere nemini potest, nisi ei, qui eam recipit atque eă delectatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Lael. 26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor misericordiam non recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus recipere (res),</quote> <trans><tr>to admit</tr>, <tr>be liable to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem casum (res),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re jam non ultra recipiente cunctationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc distinctionem recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">si recipiatur poëtica fabulositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc genere prorsus recipio hanc brevem annotationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos necessarios maxime atque in usum receptos (tropos) exequemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:20" default="NO">5, 11, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:104" default="NO">11, 3, 104</bibl>; so with a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:103" default="NO">6, 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 24 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40577.24" n="(b)" level="5"> Of opinions, etc., <hi rend="ital">to adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dial. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40577.25" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n40577.26" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi> the performance of a task consigned or intrusted to one (whereas suscipio denotes, in gen., the voluntary undertaking of any action; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spondeo, stipulor, polliceor): recepi causam Siciliae ... ego tamen hoc onere suscepto et receptā causā Siciliensi amplexus animo sum aliquanto amplius. Suscepi enim causam totius ordinis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc judicio mihi Siculorum causam receptam, populi Romani susceptam esse videor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo est illa magna offensio vel neglegentiae susceptis rebus vel perfidiae receptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verebamini, ne non id facerem, quod recepissem semel?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam Sex. Roscii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n40577.27" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> an obligation <hi rend="ital">upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pledge one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be surety for</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to warrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi> a thing to any one, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nade/xomai</foreign> (a favorite word of Cic., esp. in his Epistles): <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Tute unus si recipere hoc ad te dicis ... <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Dico et recipio Ad me, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 74</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me recipio: Faciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promitto in meque recipio, fore eum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spondeo in meque recipio eos esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promitto, recipio, spondeo, C. Caesarem talem semper fore civem, qualis hodie sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">hoc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 50, 2</bibl> (with spondeo); 6, 12, 3; 13, 41, 2 (with confirmo); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 2</bibl>; Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 14</bibl> Drak.; 33, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Cassio et te, si quid me velitis recipere, recipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aestate polliceris vel potius recipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: sed fidem recepisse sibi et ipsum et Appium de me,</quote> <trans><tr>had given him a solemn assurance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.— With <case>dat.</case> (after the analogy of promitto, polliceor, spondeo): <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae tibi promitto ac recipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnia ei et petenti recepi et ultro pollicitus sum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi is de me recepisset, in memoriam redegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi in Cumano diligentissime se, ut annui essemus, defensurum receperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit> Manut. (with confirmare); 13, 72, 1; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n40577.28" n="c" level="4"> In jurid. lang.: recipere nomen, of the prætor, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entertain a charge</hi> against one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 42, § 102</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: recipere reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inter reos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; 13, 10. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n40577.29" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">received</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">current</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas receptior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: scriptores receptissimi, Sol. praef.— </sense><sense id="n40577.30" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rĕceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (acc. to II. B. 2. b.), <hi rend="ital">an engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guaranty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis est factum Siculis, satis promisso nostro ac recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum et receptum intervertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
